trans-unit.source: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a standard that allows a server to relax the same-origin policy. This is used to explicitly allow some cross-origin requests while rejecting others. For example, if a site offers an embeddable service, it may be necessary to relax certain restrictions. Setting up such a CORS configuration isn't necessarily easy and may present some challenges. In these pages, we'll look into some common CORS error messages and how to resolve them.
trans-unit.target: 跨域资源共享（CORS）是一种标准，它允许服务器放宽同源策略。这用于显式允许某些跨域请求，同时拒绝其他请求。例如，如果站点提供可嵌入式服务，则可能有必要放宽某些限制。设置这样的CORS配置不一定很容易，并且可能会带来一些挑战。在这些页面中，我们将研究一些常见的CORS错误消息以及如何解决它们。

trans-unit.source: Feature Policy allows you to control which origins can use which features, both in the top-level page and in embedded frames. Essentially, you write a policy, which is an allowed list of origins for each feature. For every feature controlled by Feature Policy, the feature is only enabled in the current document or frame if its origin matches the allowed list of origins.
trans-unit.target: 通过功能策略，您可以在顶级页面和嵌入式框架中控制哪些来源可以使用哪些功能。本质上，您编写了一个策略，这是每个功能的允许来源列表。对于“功能策略”控制的每个功能，仅当其来源与允许的来源列表匹配时，才在当前文档或框架中启用该功能。

trans-unit.source: Pragma is a HTTP/1.0 header, it is not specified for HTTP responses and is therefore not a reliable replacement for the general HTTP/1.1 Cache-Control header, although it does behave the same as Cache-Control: no-cache, if the Cache-Control header field is omitted in a request. Use Pragma only for backwards compatibility with HTTP/1.0 clients.
trans-unit.target: Pragma 是HTTP / 1.0标头，未为HTTP响应指定，因此不是一般HTTP / 1.1 Cache-Control 标头的可靠替代，尽管它的行为与 Cache-Control: no-cache 相同：no-cache，如果请求中省略了 Cache-Control 标头字段。仅将 Pragma 用于与HTTP / 1.0客户端向后兼容。

trans-unit.source: Pragma is an HTTP/1.0 header. Pragma: no-cache is like Cache-Control: no-cache in that it forces caches to submit the request to the origin server for validation, before releasing a cached copy. However, Pragma is not specified for HTTP responses and is therefore not a reliable replacement for the general HTTP/1.1 Cache-Control header.

Unsafe requests modify the state of the server and the user shouldn't replay them inadvertently. Typically, you don't want your users to resend PUT, POST or DELETE requests. If you just serve the response as the result of this request, a simple press of the reload button will (possibly after a confirmation message), resend the request.
trans-unit.target: 不安全的请求会修改服务器的状态，用户不应无意间重播它们。通常，您不希望用户重新发送 PUT ， POST 或 DELETE 请求。如果您只是将响应作为请求的结果提供，则只需轻按重新加载按钮（可能在确认消息之后），即可重新发送请求。

trans-unit.source: Unsafe requests modify the state of the server and the user shouldn't resend them unintentionally.

trans-unit.source: WebAssembly or asm.js applications can use large contiguous blocks of allocated memory. For complex games, for example, these allocations can be quite large, sometimes as large as 1GB. The Large-Allocation tells the browser that the web content in the to-be-loaded page is going to want to perform a large contiguous memory allocation and the browser can react to this header by starting a dedicated process for the to-be-loaded document, for example.
trans-unit.target: WebAssembly或asm.js应用程序可以使用大块连续的已分配内存。例如，对于复杂的游戏，这些分配可能会很大，有时甚至会达到1GB。在 Large-Allocation 讲述的是，在以待加载页面的网页内容会希望执行大量连续的内存分配的浏览器和浏览器可以给这个头通过启动一个专用的过程中，以待加载反应例如文档。

trans-unit.source: RFC 1806 [35], from which the often implemented Content-Disposition (see section 19.5.1) header in HTTP is derived, has a number of very serious security considerations. Content-Disposition is not part of the HTTP standard, but since it is widely implemented, we are documenting its use and risks for implementors. See RFC 2183 [49] (which updates RFC 1806) for details.
trans-unit.target: RFC 1806 [ 35 ] 是HTTP中经常实现的Content-Disposition（请参阅第19.5.1节）标头，它具有许多非常重要的安全考虑。 Content-Disposition不是HTTP标准的一部分，但是由于它已被广泛实施，因此我们正在记录其使用情况以及对实施者的风险。有关详细信息，请参见RFC 2183 [ 49 ]（将更新RFC 1806）。

trans-unit.source: RFC 1945 and RFC 2068 document protocol elements used by some existing HTTP implementations, but not consistently and correctly across most HTTP/1.1 applications. Implementors are advised to be aware of these features, but cannot rely upon their presence in, or interoperability with, other HTTP/1.1 applications. Some of these describe proposed experimental features, and some describe features that experimental deployment found lacking that are now addressed in the base HTTP/1.1 specification. A number of other headers, such as Content-Disposition and Title, from SMTP and MIME are also often implemented (see RFC 2076 [37]).
trans-unit.target: RFC 1945和RFC 2068记录了一些现有HTTP实现所使用的协议元素，但在大多数HTTP / 1.1应用程序中却不一致且正确。建议实现者注意这些功能，但不能依赖于它们在其他HTTP / 1.1应用程序中的存在或与它们的互操作性。其中一些描述了建议的实验功能，另一些描述了实验部署发现的功能，这些功能现在已在基本HTTP / 1.1规范中解决。 SMTP和MIME中的许多其他标头（例如Content-Disposition和Title）也经常被实现（请参阅RFC 2076 [ 37 ]）。

trans-unit.source: RFC 2045 [7] requires that an Internet mail entity be converted to canonical form prior to being transferred, as described in section 4 of RFC 2049 [48]. Section 3.7.1 of this document describes the forms allowed for subtypes of the "text" media type when transmitted over HTTP. RFC 2046 requires that content with a type of "text" represent line breaks as CRLF and forbids the use of CR or LF outside of line break sequences. HTTP allows CRLF, bare CR, and bare LF to indicate a line break within text content when a message is transmitted over HTTP. Where it is possible, a proxy or gateway from HTTP to a strict MIME environment SHOULD translate all line breaks within the text media types described in section 3.7.1 of this document to the RFC 2049 canonical form of CRLF. Note, however, that this might be complicated by the presence of a Content-Encoding and by the fact that HTTP allows the use of some character sets which do not use octets 13 and 10 to represent CR and LF, as is the case for some multi-byte character sets. Implementors should note that conversion will break any cryptographic checksums applied to the original content unless the original content is already in canonical form. Therefore, the canonical form is recommended for any content that uses such checksums in HTTP.
trans-unit.target: RFC 2045 [ 7 ]要求在传输之前将Internet邮件实体转换为规范形式，如RFC 2049 [ 48 ]的第4节所述。本文档的3.7.1节介绍了通过HTTP传输时“文本”媒体类型的子类型所允许的形式。RFC 2046要求类型为“文本”的内容将换行符表示为CRLF，并禁止在换行符序列之外使用CR或LF。通过HTTP传输消息时，HTTP允许CRLF，裸CR和裸LF指示文本内容内的换行符。在可能的情况下，从HTTP到严格的MIME环境的代理或网关应将本文档第3.7.1节中描述的文本媒体类型内的所有换行符转换为RFC 2049 CRLF的规范形式。但是请注意，由于Content-Encoding的存在以及HTTP允许使用某些不使用八位位组13和10来表示CR和LF的字符集的情况（例如某些字符集的情况），这可能会使情况变得复杂多字节字符集。实施者应注意，除非原始内容已经是规范形式，否则转换将破坏应用于原始内容的任何密码校验和。因此，对于在HTTP中使用此类校验和的任何内容，建议使用规范形式。

trans-unit.source: RFC 2045 does not include any concept equivalent to HTTP/1.1's Content-Encoding header field. Since this acts as a modifier on the media type, proxies and gateways from HTTP to MIME-compliant protocols MUST either change the value of the Content-Type header field or decode the entity-body before forwarding the message. (Some experimental applications of Content-Type for Internet mail have used a media-type parameter of ";conversions=<content-coding>" to perform a function equivalent to Content-Encoding. However, this parameter is not part of RFC 2045.)
trans-unit.target: RFC 2045不包括与HTTP / 1.1的Content-Encoding标头字段等效的任何概念。由于这是对媒体类型的修改，因此从HTTP到MIME兼容协议的代理和网关必须在转发消息之前更改Content-Type头字段的值或解码实体。 （Internet邮件的Content-Type的某些实验性应用程序使用媒体类型参数“; conversions = <content-coding>”来执行与Content-Encoding等效的功能。但是，此参数不是RFC 2045的一部分。 ）

trans-unit.source: RFC 7235 defines the HTTP authentication framework which can be used by a server to challenge a client request and by a client to provide authentication information. The challenge and response flow works like this: The server responds to a client with a 401 (Unauthorized) response status and provides information on how to authorize with a WWW-Authenticate response header containing at least one challenge. A client that wants to authenticate itself with a server can then do so by including an Authorization request header field with the credentials. Usually a client will present a password prompt to the user and will then issue the request including the correct Authorization header.
trans-unit.target: RFC 7235定义了HTTP身份验证框架，服务器可以使用它来质询客户端请求，客户端可以使用它来提供身份验证信息。质询和响应流程的工作方式如下：服务器以 401 （未授权）响应状态响应客户端，并提供有关如何使用包含至少一个质询的 WWW-Authenticate 响应标头进行授权的信息。想要通过服务器进行身份验证的客户端可以通过在 Authorization 请求标头字段中添加凭据来进行身份验证。通常，客户端会向用户显示密码提示，然后发出包含正确的 Authorization 标头的请求。

trans-unit.source: RFC 7235 defines the HTTP authentication framework, which can be used by a server to challenge a client request, and by a client to provide authentication information.

trans-unit.source: Location and Content-Location are different. Location indicates the URL of a redirect, while Content-Location indicates the direct URL to use to access the resource, without further content negotiation in the future. Location is a header associated with the response, while Content-Location is associated with the data returned. This distinction may seem abstract without examples.
trans-unit.target: Location 和 Content-Location 不同。 Location 表示重定向的URL，而 Content-Location 表示用于访问资源的直接URL，以后无需进行进一步的内容协商。 Location 是与响应关联的标头，而 Content-Location 与返回的数据关联。没有实例，这种区别似乎很抽象。

trans-unit.source: POST, GET, and OPTIONS are permitted methods for the URL. (This header is similar to the Allow response header, but used only for CORS.)

HTTP response status codes indicate if a specific HTTP request has been successfully completed. Responses are grouped into five classes: informational responses, successful responses, redirects, client errors, and servers errors.
trans-unit.target: HTTP响应状态代码指示特定的HTTP请求是否已成功完成。响应分为五类：信息响应，成功响应，重定向，客户端错误和服务器错误。

trans-unit.source: 301: Moved Permanently. This response code means that the URI of requested resource has been changed.
trans-unit.target: 301 ：永久移动。此响应代码表示所请求资源的URI已更改。

trans-unit.source: 304 (Not Modified) redirects a page to the locally cached copy (that was stale), and 300 (Multiple Choice) is a manual redirection: the body, presented by the browser as a Web page, lists the possible redirections and the user clicks on one to select it.
404: Not Found. The server cannot find the requested resource.
trans-unit.target: 404 ：未找到。服务器找不到请求的资源。

trans-unit.source: Via – provides information about the proxy itself, not about the client connecting to it.
trans-unit.target: Via –提供有关代理本身的信息，而不是有关连接到它的客户端的信息。

trans-unit.source: #SomewhereInTheDocument is an anchor to another part of the resource itself. An anchor represents a sort of "bookmark" inside the resource, giving the browser the directions to show the content located at that "bookmarked" spot. On an HTML document, for example, the browser will scroll to the point where the anchor is defined; on a video or audio document, the browser will try to go to the time the anchor represents. It is worth noting that the part after the #, also known as fragment identifier, is never sent to the server with the request.
trans-unit.target: #SomewhereInTheDocument 是资源本身另一部分的锚点。锚点代表资源内的一种“书签”，为浏览器提供了指示，以显示位于该“已标记”点的内容。例如，在HTML文档上，浏览器将滚动到定义锚点的位置。在视频或音频文档上，浏览器将尝试转到锚点表示的时间。值得注意的是，＃之后的部分（也称为片段标识符）永远不会随请求发送到服务器。

trans-unit.source: 'W/' (case-sensitive) indicates that a weak validator is used. Weak etags are easy to generate, but are far less useful for comparisons. Strong validators are ideal for comparisons but can be very difficult to generate efficiently. Weak ETag values of two representations of the same resources might be semantically equivalent, but not byte-for-byte identical. This means weak etags prevent caching when byte range requests are used, but strong etags mean range requests can still be cached.

'W/' (case-sensitive) indicates that a weak validator is used. Weak validators are easy to generate but are far less useful for comparisons. Strong validators are ideal for comparisons but can be very difficult to generate efficiently. Weak Etag values of two representations of the same resources might be semantically equivalent, but not byte-for-byte identical.
trans-unit.target: 'W/' （区分大小写）表示使用了弱验证器。弱验证器很容易生成，但对比较却没有多大用处。强大的验证器是比较的理想选择，但很难高效生成。相同资源的两种表示形式的弱 Etag 值在语义上可能等效，但逐字节不相同。

trans-unit.source: 'blob:' Allows blob: URIs to be used as a content source.
trans-unit.target: 'blob:' 允许将 blob: URI用作内容源。

trans-unit.source: 'filesystem:' Allows filesystem: URIs to be used as a content source.
'mediastream:' Allows mediastream: URIs to be used as a content source.
'none': The feature is disabled in top-level and nested browsing contexts.
trans-unit.target: 'none' ：该功能在顶级和嵌套浏览上下文中被禁用。

trans-unit.source: 'self': (Default) The feature is allowed by default in top-level browsing contexts and in nested browsing contexts (iframes) in the same origin. The feature is not allowed in cross-origin documents in nested browsing contexts.
trans-unit.target: 'self' ：（默认值）默认情况下，该功能在顶级浏览上下文和同一来源的嵌套浏览上下文（iframe）中被允许。嵌套浏览上下文中的跨域文档中不允许使用此功能。

trans-unit.source: 'self': The feature is allowed by default in top-level browsing contexts and in nested browsing contexts (iframes) in the same origin. The feature is not allowed in cross-origin documents in nested browsing contexts.
trans-unit.target: 'self' ：默认情况下，顶级浏览上下文中和同一来源的嵌套浏览上下文（iframe）中都允许使用此功能。嵌套浏览上下文中的跨域文档中不允许使用此功能。

trans-unit.source: 'self': The feature will be allowed in this document, and in all nested browsing contexts (iframes) in the same origin.
trans-unit.target: 'self' ：此文档以及同一来源的所有嵌套浏览上下文（iframe）中都将允许使用该功能。

trans-unit.source: 'src': (In an iframe allow attribute only) The feature will be allowed in this iframe, as long as the document loaded into it comes from the same origin as the URL in the iframe's src attribute.
'src': (In an iframe allow attribute only) The feature will be allowed in this iframe, as long as the document loaded into it comes from the same origin as the URL in the iframe's src attribute.
trans-unit.target: 'src' ：（仅在iframe allow属性中）此功能将被允许在此iframe中使用，只要加载到其中的文档与iframe src属性中的URL来自同一来源即可。

trans-unit.source: *.example.com: Matches all attempts to load from any subdomain of example.com using the current protocol.
*: The feature is allowed by default in top-level browsing contexts and all nested browsing contexts (iframes).
trans-unit.target: * ：默认情况下，顶级浏览上下文和所有嵌套浏览上下文（iframe）中均允许使用该功能。

trans-unit.source: *: The feature will be allowed in this document, and all nested browsing contexts (iframes) regardless of their origin.
trans-unit.target: * ：此功能以及所有嵌套的浏览上下文（iframe）都将在此文档中使用，无论其来源如何。

trans-unit.source: /csp-violation-report-endpoint/ could for example run a PHP something like the following that logs the JSON detailing the violation and, if the violation is the first one added to the log file, sends an email to an administrator:
trans-unit.target: /csp-violation-report-endpoint/ 可以例如运行以下类似的PHP，记录详细记录违规的JSON，如果违规是添加到日志文件中的第一个，则向管理员发送电子邮件：

trans-unit.source: /path/to/myfile.html is the path to the resource on the Web server. In the early days of the Web, a path like this represented a physical file location on the Web server. Nowadays, it is mostly an abstraction handled by Web servers without any physical reality.
trans-unit.target: /path/to/myfile.html 是Web服务器上资源的路径。在Web的早期，这样的路径表示Web服务器上的物理文件位置。如今，它主要是由Web服务器处理的抽象，没有任何物理现实。

trans-unit.source: 1xx warn-codes describe the freshness or validation status of the response and will be deleted by a cache after deletion.
trans-unit.target: 1xx 警告代码描述了响应的新鲜度或验证状态，并且将在删除后由缓存删除。

trans-unit.source: 2xx warn-codes describe some aspect of the representation that is not rectified by a validation and won't be deleted by a cache after validation unless a full response is sent.
trans-unit.target: 2xx 警告代码描述了表示的某些方面，该方面无法通过验证进行纠正，并且除非经过完整响应发送，否则在验证之后不会被缓存删除。

trans-unit.source: 501 is the appropriate response when the server does not recognize the request method and is incapable of supporting it for any resource. The only methods that servers are required to support (and therefore that must not return 501) are GET and HEAD.

:80 is the port in this instance. It indicates the technical "gate" used to access the resources on the web server. It is usually omitted if the web server uses the standard ports of the HTTP protocol (80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS) to grant access to its resources. Otherwise it is mandatory.
trans-unit.target: :80 是此实例中的端口。它指示用于访问Web服务器上资源的技术“门”。如果Web服务器使用HTTP协议的标准端口（对于HTTP为80，对于HTTPS为443）来授予对其资源的访问权限，则通常将其省略。否则，它是强制性的。

trans-unit.source: appname/appversion indicates the application name and version. For instance, this could be "Camino/2.1.1", or "SeaMonkey/2.7.1".
trans-unit.target: appname/appversion 指示应用程序名称和版本。例如，它可以是“ Camino/2.1.1 ”或“ SeaMonkey/2.7.1 ”。

trans-unit.source: platform describes the native platform the browser is running on (e.g. Windows, Mac, Linux or Android), and whether or not it's a mobile phone. Firefox OS phones simply say "Mobile"; the web is the platform. Note that platform can consist of multiple "; "-separated tokens. See below for further details and examples.
trans-unit.target: platform 描述了浏览器正在运行的本机平台（例如Windows，Mac，Linux或Android），以及它是否为手机。 Firefox OS手机只是说“ Mobile ”。网络是平台。请注意， platform 可以包含多个“;”分隔的令牌。有关更多详细信息和示例，请参见下文。

trans-unit.source: ?key1=value1&key2=value2 are extra parameters provided to the Web server. Those parameters are a list of key/value pairs separated with the & symbol. The Web server can use those parameters to do extra stuff before returning the resource to the user. Each Web server has its own rules regarding parameters, and the only reliable way to know how a specific Web server is handling parameters is by asking the Web server owner.
trans-unit.target: ?key1=value1&key2=value2 是提供给Web服务器的额外参数。这些参数是用 & 符号分隔的键/值对的列表。在将资源返回给用户之前，Web服务器可以使用这些参数做一些额外的工作。每个Web服务器都有自己的参数规则，而了解特定Web服务器如何处理参数的唯一可靠方法是询问Web服务器所有者。

trans-unit.source: Access-Control-Allow-Origin specifies either a single origin, which tells browsers to allow that origin to access the resource; or else — for requests without credentials — the "*" wildcard, to tell browsers to allow any origin to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: Access-Control-Allow-Origin 指定一个来源，告诉浏览器允许该来源访问资源。否则-对于没有凭据的请求-“ * ”通配符，告诉浏览器允许任何源访问资源。

trans-unit.source: Domain specifies allowed hosts to receive the cookie. If unspecified, it defaults to the host of the current document location, excluding subdomains. If Domainis specified, then subdomains are always included.
trans-unit.target: Domain 指定允许主机接收cookie。如果未指定，则默认为当前文档位置的主机，不包括subdomains。如果 Domain 被指定，那么子域总是被包括在内。

trans-unit.source: Firefox/firefoxversion indicates the browser is Firefox, and provides the version (such as "17.0").
trans-unit.target: Firefox/firefoxversion 表示浏览器是Firefox，并提供了版本（例如“ 17.0 ”）。

trans-unit.source: Firefox/firefoxversion is an optional compatibility token that some Gecko-based browsers may choose to incorporate, to achieve maximum compatibility with websites that expect Firefox. firefoxversion will generally represent the equivalent Firefox release corresponding to the given Gecko version. Some Gecko-based browsers may not opt into using this token; for this reason, sniffers should be looking for Gecko — not Firefox! Whether this token appears is controlled by the "general.useragent.compatMode.firefox" boolean pref.
trans-unit.target: Firefox/firefoxversion 是一些基于Gecko的浏览器可能选择合并的可选兼容性令牌，以实现与期望Firefox的网站的最大兼容性。 firefoxversion 通常将表示与给定Gecko版本相对应的等效Firefox版本。一些基于Gecko的浏览器可能不选择使用此令牌。因此，嗅探器应该寻找Gecko，而不是Firefox！此令牌是否显示由“ general.useragent.compatMode.firefox”布尔值首选项控制。

trans-unit.source: GET: The resource has been fetched and is transmitted in the message body.
Gecko/geckotrail indicates that the browser is based on Gecko.
HEAD: The entity headers are in the message body.
If-None-Match will only work with HTTP/1.1 (and later) compliant servers. If unsure if the server will be compliant, you need first to issue a HEAD request to the resource to check this.
trans-unit.target: If-None-Match 仅适用于兼容HTTP / 1.1（及更高版本）的服务器。如果不确定服务器是否符合要求，则首先需要向资源发出 HEAD 请求以进行检查。

trans-unit.source: Lax: The cookie is withheld on cross-site subrequests, such as calls to load images or frames, but is sent when a user navigates to the URL from an external site, such as by following a link.

Location and Content-Location are different: Location indicates the target of a redirection (or the URL of a newly created resource), while Content-Location indicates the direct URL to use to access the resource when content negotiation happened, without the need of further content negotiation. Location is a header associated with the response, while Content-Location is associated with the entity returned.
trans-unit.target: Location 和 Content-Location 是不同的： Location 表示重定向的目标（或新创建的资源的URL），而 Content-Location 表示在进行内容协商时用于访问资源的直接URL ，而无需进行进一步的协商。内容协商。 Location 是与响应相关联的标头，而 Content-Location 与返回的实体相关联。

trans-unit.source: Mozilla/5.0 is the general token that says the browser is Mozilla compatible, and is common to almost every browser today.
trans-unit.target: Mozilla/5.0 是表示该浏览器与Mozilla兼容的通用标记，并且对于当今几乎所有浏览器都是通用的。

trans-unit.source: Mozilla/5.0 is the general token that says the browser is Mozilla-compatible. For historical reasons, almost every browser today sends it.
None: The browser sends the cookie with both cross-site and same-site requests.
Origin can be the empty string: this is useful, for example, if the source is a data URL.
trans-unit.target: Origin 可以是空字符串：这很有用，例如，如果源是 data URL。

trans-unit.source: PATCH (like POST) may have side-effects on other resources.

trans-unit.target: PATCH （如 PUT ）可能会对其他资源产生副作用。

trans-unit.source: PATCH is somewhat analogous to the "update" concept found in CRUD (in general, HTTP is different than CRUD, and the two should not be confused).
PUT or POST: The resource describing the result of the action is transmitted in the message body.
Path indicates a URL path that must exist in the requested URL in order to send the Cookie header. The %x2F ("/") character is considered a directory separator, and subdirectories will match as well.
trans-unit.target: Path 表示在URL中必须存在的URL路径才能发送 Cookie 标头。％x2F（“ /”）字符被视为目录分隔符，并且子目录也将匹配。

trans-unit.source: Pragma should only be used for backwards compatibility with HTTP/1.0 caches where the Cache-Control HTTP/1.1 header is not yet present.
RedirectMatch does the same but takes a regular expression to define a collection of URLs that are affected:
trans-unit.target: RedirectMatch 的作用相同，但采用正则表达式来定义受影响的URL的集合：

trans-unit.source: RedirectMatch does the same, but takes a regular expression to define a collection of affected URLs:

SameSite cookies let servers require that a cookie shouldn't be sent with cross-site requests, which somewhat protects against cross-site request forgery attacks (CSRF). SameSite cookies are still experimental and not yet supported by all browsers.
trans-unit.target: SameSite cookie使服务器要求不应将cookie与跨站点请求一起发送，这在某种程度上可以防止跨站点请求伪造攻击（CSRF）。 SameSite cookie仍处于试验阶段，尚不受所有浏览器支持。

trans-unit.source: Strict: The browser sends the cookie only for same-site requests (that is, requests originating from the same site that set the cookie). If the request originated from a different URL than the current one, no cookies with the SameSite=Strict attribute are sent.
TRACE: The message body contains the request message as received by the server.

Transfer-Encoding is a hop-by-hop header, that is applied to a message between two nodes, not to a resource itself. Each segment of a multi-node connection can use different Transfer-Encoding values. If you want to compress data over the whole connection, use the end-to-end Content-Encoding header instead.
trans-unit.target: Transfer-Encoding 是逐跳头，适用于两个节点之间的消息，而不是资源本身。多节点连接的每个段都可以使用不同的 Transfer-Encoding 值。如果要在整个连接上压缩数据，请改用端到端 Content-Encoding 标头。

trans-unit.source: User-Agent has even more variation than Accept-Encoding. So if using Vary: User-Agent for caching mobile/desktop variants of files you'd similarly check for the presence of "mobile" and "desktop" in the request User-Agent header, and then clear it.
Warning header fields can in general be applied to any message, however some warn-codes are specific to caches and can only be applied to response messages.
trans-unit.target: Warning 标头字段通常可以应用于任何消息，但是某些警告代码特定于缓存，并且只能应用于响应消息。

trans-unit.source: X-Forwarded-For is also an email-header indicating that an email-message was forwarded from another account.
trans-unit.target: X-Forwarded-For 也是电子邮件标头，指示已从另一个帐户转发电子邮件。

trans-unit.source: __Host-: Cookies with a name starting with __Host- must be set with the secure flag, must be from a secure page (HTTPS), must not have a domain specified (and therefore aren't sent to subdomains) and the path must be "/".
trans-unit.target: __Host- ：名称以 __Host- 开头的Cookie必须设置为 secure 标志，必须来自安全页面（HTTPS），不得指定域（因此不会发送到子域），并且路径必须为“ /”。

trans-unit.source: __Host-: Cookies with names starting with __Host- must be set with the secure flag, must be from a secure page (HTTPS), must not have a domain specified (and therefore aren't sent to subdomains) and the path must be /.
__Secure-: Cookies names starting with __Secure- (dash is part of the prefix) must be set with the secure flag from a secure page (HTTPS).
__Secure-: Cookies with a name starting with __Secure- (dash is part of the prefix) must be set with the secure flag and must be from a secure page (HTTPS).
trans-unit.target: __Secure- ：名称以 __Secure- 开头的Cookie（破折号是前缀的一部分），必须设置带有 secure 标志，并且必须来自安全页面（HTTPS）。

trans-unit.source: application/octet-stream is the default value for all other cases. An unknown file type should use this type. Browsers pay a particular care when manipulating these files, attempting to safeguard the user to prevent dangerous behaviors.
trans-unit.target: application/octet-stream 是所有其他情况的默认值。未知文件类型应使用此类型。浏览器在处理这些文件时要格外小心，试图保护用户以防止危险行为。

trans-unit.source: application/x-www-form-urlencoded: the keys and values are encoded in key-value tuples separated by '&', with a '=' between the key and the value. Non-alphanumeric characters in both keys and values are percent encoded: this is the reason why this type is not suitable to use with binary data (use multipart/form-data instead)
trans-unit.target: application/x-www-form-urlencoded ：键和值编码在键值元组中，以 '&' 分隔，键和值之间带有 '=' 。键和值中的非字母数字字符均按百分比编码：这是此类型不适用于二进制数据的原因（请改用 multipart/form-data ）

trans-unit.source: blob: Allows blob: URIs to be used as a content source.
data: Allows data: URIs to be used as a content source. This is insecure; an attacker can also inject arbitrary data: URIs. Use this sparingly and definitely not for scripts.
trans-unit.target: data: 允许 data: URI用作内容源。这是不安全的；攻击者还可以注入任意数据：URI。谨慎使用，绝对不要用于脚本。

trans-unit.source: filesystem: Allows filesystem: URIs to be used as a content source.
http://*.example.com: Matches all attempts to load from any subdomain of example.com using the http: URL scheme.
trans-unit.target: http://*.example.com ：匹配所有使用 http: URL方案从example.com的任何子域加载的尝试。

trans-unit.source: http:// is the protocol. It indicates which protocol the browser must use. Usually it is the HTTP protocol or its secured version, HTTPS. The Web requires one of these two, but browsers also know how to handle other protocols such as mailto: (to open a mail client) or ftp: to handle file transfer, so don't be surprised if you see such protocols. Common schemes are:
trans-unit.target: http:// 是协议。它指示浏览器必须使用的协议。通常，它是HTTP协议或其安全版本HTTPS。Web需要这两者之一，但是浏览器也知道如何处理其他协议，例如 mailto: 打开邮件客户端）或 ftp: 处理文件传输，因此，如果您看到这样的协议，请不要感到惊讶。常见的方案是：

trans-unit.source: https://store.example.com: Matches all attempts to access store.example.com using https:.
trans-unit.target: https://store.example.com ：匹配所有使用 https: 访问store.example.com的尝试。

trans-unit.source: mail.example.com:443: Matches all attempts to access port 443 on mail.example.com.
trans-unit.target: mail.example.com:443 ：匹配所有尝试访问mail.example.com上端口443的尝试。

trans-unit.source: max: indicating the maximum number of requests that can be sent on this connection before closing it. Unless 0, this value is ignored for non-pipelined connections as another request will be send in the next response. An HTTP pipeline can use it to limit the pipelining.
trans-unit.target: max ：指示在关闭连接之前可以在此连接上发送的最大请求数。除非为 0 ，否则对于非流水线连接，将忽略此值，因为另一个请求将在下一个响应中发送。HTTP管道可以使用它来限制管道。

trans-unit.source: max: indicating the maximum number of requests that can be sent on this connection before closing it. Unless 0, this value is ignored for non-pipelined connections as another request will be sent in the next response. An HTTP pipeline can use it to limit the pipelining.
mediastream: Allows mediastream: URIs to be used as a content source.

multipart/form-data: each value is sent as a block of data ("body part"), with a user agent-defined delimiter ("boundary") separating each part. The keys are given in the Content-Disposition header of each part.
rv:geckoversion indicates the release version of Gecko (such as "17.0"). In recent browsers, geckoversion is the same as firefoxversion.
trans-unit.target: rv:geckoversion 表示Gecko的发行版本（例如“ 17.0 ”）。在最近的浏览器中， geckoversion 与 firefoxversion 相同。

trans-unit.source: text/css and text/javascript are historical accidents, as neither are intended to be read by humans — the correct type for JavaScript is application/javascript. (HTML is theoretically human-readable.)
trans-unit.target: text/css 和 text/javascript 是历史性的意外，因为它们都不是人类可读的-JavaScript的正确类型是 application/javascript 。（HTML在理论上是人类可读的。）

trans-unit.source: text/json, application/json or any other type with a JSON extension: */*+json
text/plain is the default value for textual files. A textual file should be human-readable and must not contain binary data.
trans-unit.target: text/plain 是文本文件的默认值。文本文件应易于阅读，并且不得包含二进制数据。

trans-unit.source: text/xml if readable from casual users (RFC 3023, section 3)
text/xml, application/xml or any other type with an XML extension: */*+xml (excluding image/svg+xml)

timeout: indicating the minimum amount of time an idle connection has to be kept opened (in seconds). Note that timeouts longer than the TCP timeout may be ignored if no keep-alive TCP message is set at the transport level.
trans-unit.target: timeout ：指示空闲连接必须保持打开状态的最短时间（以秒为单位）。请注意，如果在传输级别未设置保持活动的TCP消息，则可以忽略超过TCP超时的超时。

trans-unit.source: www.example.com is the domain name or authority that governs the namespace. It indicates which Web server is being requested. Alternatively, it is possible to directly use an IP address, but because it is less convenient, it is not often used on the Web.
trans-unit.target: www.example.com 是管理名称空间的域名或授权机构。它指示正在请求哪个Web服务器。另外，也可以直接使用IP地址，但是由于它不太方便，因此在Web上不经常使用。

trans-unit.source: Firefox/firefoxversion indicates the browser is Firefox, and provides the version (such as "17.0").
trans-unit.target: Firefox / firefoxversion表示浏览器是Firefox，并提供了版本（例如“ 17.0”）。

trans-unit.source: Mozilla/5.0 is the general token that says the browser is Mozilla compatible, and is common to almost every browser today.
trans-unit.target: Mozilla / 5.0是表示该浏览器与Mozilla兼容的通用标记，并且对于当今几乎所有浏览器都是通用的。

trans-unit.source: CSP 1.1 and CSP 3.0 doesn't extend the HTTP standard
Defines extensions of HTTP for Server-Sent Events
trans-unit.target: 为服务器发送的事件定义HTTP扩展

trans-unit.source: Discrete types indicate the category of the document. They can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Entity headers, like Content-Length which apply to the body of the request. Obviously there is no such header transmitted if there is no body in the request.

trans-unit.source: Multipart types indicate a category of document broken into pieces, often with different MIME types. They represent a composite document. With the exception of multipart/form-data, used in the POST method of HTML Forms, and multipart/byteranges, used with 206Partial Content to send part of a document, HTTP doesn't handle multipart documents in a special way: the message is transmitted to the browser (which will likely show a "Save As" window if it doesn't know how to display the document.)
trans-unit.target: 多部分类型表示文档的类别，通常分为不同的MIME类型。它们代表一个复合文档。除了在HTML Forms的 POST 方法中使用的 multipart/form-data 和在 206 Partial Content 中用于发送部分文档的 multipart/byteranges 之外，HTTP不会以特殊方式处理多部分文档：消息传输到浏览器（如果不知道如何显示文档，浏览器可能会显示“另存为”窗口。）

trans-unit.source: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application-layer protocol for transmitting hypermedia documents, such as HTML. It was designed for communication between web browsers and web servers, but it can also be used for other purposes. HTTP follows a classical client-server model, with a client opening a connection to make a request, then waiting until it receives a response. HTTP is a stateless protocol, meaning that the server does not keep any data (state) between two requests. Though often based on a TCP/IP layer, it can be used on any reliable transport layer, that is, a protocol that doesn't lose messages silently like UDP does. RUDP — the reliable update of UDP — is a suitable alternative.

Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application-layer protocol for transmitting hypermedia documents, such as HTML. It was designed for communication between web browsers and web servers, but it can also be used for other purposes. HTTP follows a classical client-server model, with a client opening a connection to make a request, then waiting until it receives a response. HTTP is a stateless protocol, meaning that the server does not keep any data (state) between two requests. Though often based on a TCP/IP layer, it can be used on any reliable transport layer; that is, a protocol that doesn't lose messages silently, such as UDP.
trans-unit.target: 超文本传输​​协议（HTTP）是用于传输超媒体文档（例如HTML）的应用层协议。它是为Web浏览器和Web服务器之间的通信而设计的，但也可以用于其他目的。HTTP遵循经典的客户端-服务器模型，客户端打开连接以发出请求，然后等待直到收到响应。HTTP是一种无状态协议，表示服务器在两个请求之间不保留任何数据（状态）。尽管通常基于TCP / IP层，但它可以在任何可靠的传输层上使用；也就是说，不会默默丢失消息的协议，例如UDP。

trans-unit.source: Content Security Policy (CSP) is an added layer of security that helps to detect and mitigate certain types of attacks, including Cross Site Scripting (XSS) and data injection attacks. These attacks are used for everything from data theft to site defacement to distribution of malware.
trans-unit.target: 内容安全策略（CSP）是安全性的附加层，有助于检测和缓解某些类型的攻击，包括跨站点脚本（XSS）和数据注入攻击。这些攻击可用于从数据盗窃，站点损坏到恶意软件分发的所有内容。
内容类型，HTTP，引用，请求标头，标头

trans-unit.source: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is an HTTP-header based mechanism that allows a server to indicate any other origins (domain, protocol, or port) than its own from which a browser should permit loading of resources. CORS also relies on a mechanism by which browsers make a “preflight” request to the server hosting the cross-origin resource, in order to check that the server will permit the actual request. In that preflight, the browser sends headers that indicate the HTTP method and headers that will be used in the actual request.

Cross-site HTTP requests are HTTP requests for resources from a different domain than the domain of the resource making the request. For instance, an HTML page from Domain A (http://domaina.example/) makes a request for an image on Domain B (http://domainb.foo/image.jpg) via the img element. Web pages today very commonly load cross-site resources, including CSS stylesheets, images, scripts, and other resources. CORS allows web developers to control how their site reacts to cross-site requests.
trans-unit.target: 跨站点HTTP请求是对来自与发出请求的资源的域不同的域的资源的HTTP请求。例如，来自域A（ http://domaina.example/ ）的HTML页面通过 img 元素请求域B（ http://domainb.foo/image.jpg ）上的图像。当今，Web页面通常会加载跨站点资源，包括CSS样式表，图像，脚本和其他资源。CORS允许Web开发人员控制其站点对跨站点请求的反应。

trans-unit.source: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is the underlying protocol of the World Wide Web. Developed by Tim Berners-Lee and his team between 1989-1991, HTTP has seen many changes, keeping most of the simplicity and further shaping its flexibility. HTTP has evolved from an early protocol to exchange files in a semi-trusted laboratory environment, to the modern maze of the Internet, now carrying images, videos in high resolution and 3D.
trans-unit.target: HTTP（超文本传输​​协议）是万维网的基础协议。 HTTP由Tim Berners-Lee和他的团队在1989年至1991年之间开发，已经经历了许多变化，保留了大多数的简单性并进一步塑造了其灵活性。 HTTP已经从早期的协议发展为在半信任的实验室环境中交换文件，到现代的Internet迷宫，现在可以传输高分辨率的图像，视频和3D。

trans-unit.source: HTTP is a protocol which allows the fetching of resources, such as HTML documents. It is the foundation of any data exchange on the Web and a client-server protocol, which means requests are initiated by the recipient, usually the Web browser. A complete document is reconstructed from the different sub-documents fetched, for instance text, layout description, images, videos, scripts, and more.
trans-unit.target: HTTP是一种协议，它允许资源，诸如HTML文档的抓取。它是Web上任何数据交换和客户端-服务器协议的基础，这意味着请求是由收件人（通常是Web浏览器）发起的。从获取的不同子文档中重建一个完整的文档，例如文本，布局描述，图像，视频，脚本等。

trans-unit.source: HTTP is a protocol which allows the fetching of resources, such as HTML documents. It is the foundation of any data exchange on the Web and it is a client-server protocol, which means requests are initiated by the recipient, usually the Web browser. A complete document is reconstructed from the different sub-documents fetched, for instance text, layout description, images, videos, scripts, and more.

trans-unit.source: Important: Browsers use the MIME type, not the file extension, to determine how to process a URL, so it's important that web servers send the correct MIME type in the response's Content-Type header. If this is not correctly configured, browsers are likely to misinterpret the contents of files and sites will not work correctly, and downloaded files may be mishandled.

Important: Although this header has many innocent uses it can have undesirable consequences for user security and privacy. See Referer header: privacy and security concerns for more information and mitigations.
trans-unit.target: 重要说明：尽管此标头有许多无害的用法，但对于用户安全和隐私可能会产生不良后果。有关更多信息和缓解措施，请参阅引荐标题：隐私和安全问题。

trans-unit.source: A "cache" is a local store of previous response messages and the subsystem that controls its message storage, retrieval, and deletion. A cache stores cacheable responses in order to reduce the response time and network bandwidth consumption on future, equivalent requests. Any client or server MAY employ a cache, though a cache cannot be used by a server while it is acting as a tunnel. The effect of a cache is that the request/response chain is shortened if one of the participants along the chain has a cached response applicable to that request. The following illustrates the resulting chain if B has a cached copy of an earlier response from O (via C) for a request that has not been cached by UA or A. > > UA =========== A =========== B - - - - - - C - - - - - - O < < A response is "cacheable" if a cache is allowed to store a copy of the response message for use in answering subsequent requests. Even when a response is cacheable, there might be additional constraints placed by the client or by the origin server on when that cached response can be used for a particular request. HTTP requirements for cache behavior and cacheable responses are defined in Section 2 of [RFC7234]. There is a wide variety of architectures and configurations of caches deployed across the World Wide Web and inside large organizations. These include national hierarchies of proxy caches to save transoceanic bandwidth, collaborative systems that broadcast or multicast cache entries, archives of pre-fetched cache entries for use in off-line or high-latency environments, and so on.
trans-unit.target: “缓存”是先前响应消息和控制其消息存储，检索和删除的子系统的本地存储。缓存存储可缓存的响应，以减少响应时间和未来等效请求的网络带宽消耗。任何客户端或服务器都可以使用高速缓存，尽管服务器在充当隧道时不能使用高速缓存。缓存的效果是，如果链中的参与者之一具有适用于该请求的缓存响应，则请求/响应链会缩短。下图说明了如果B拥有来自O（通过C）的较早响应的缓存副本（对于尚未由UA或A缓存的请求）的结果链。UA =========== A =========== B-------C-----O <<如果缓存，响应是“可缓存的”允许存储响应消息的副本以用于回答后续请求。即使响应是可缓存的，当该缓存的响应可用于特定请求时，客户端或原始服务器可能还会设置其他约束。缓存行为和可缓存响应的HTTP要求在当该缓存的响应可用于特定请求时，客户端或原始服务器可能会附加其他约束。缓存行为和可缓存响应的HTTP要求在当该缓存的响应可用于特定请求时，客户端或原始服务器可能会附加其他约束。缓存行为和可缓存响应的HTTP要求在[RFC7234]的第2节。跨万维网和大型组织内部部署的缓存的体系结构和配置多种多样。这些措施包括用于节省跨洋带宽的代理缓存的国家层次结构，广播或多播缓存项的协作系统，用于离线或高延迟环境的预取缓存项的存档等。

trans-unit.source: A "stale" response is one that either has explicit expiry information or is allowed to have heuristic expiry calculated, but is not fresh according to the calculations in Section 4.2. A cache MUST NOT generate a stale response if it is prohibited by an explicit in-protocol directive (e.g., by a "no-store" or "no-cache" cache directive, a "must-revalidate" cache-response-directive, or an applicable "s-maxage" or "proxy-revalidate" cache-response-directive; see Section 5.2.2). A cache MUST NOT send stale responses unless it is disconnected (i.e., it cannot contact the origin server or otherwise find a forward path) or doing so is explicitly allowed (e.g., by the max-stale request directive; see Section 5.2.1). A cache SHOULD generate a Warning header field with the 110 warn-code (see Section 5.5.1) in stale responses. Likewise, a cache SHOULD generate a 112 warn-code (see Section 5.5.3) in stale responses if the cache is disconnected. A cache SHOULD NOT generate a new Warning header field when forwarding a response that does not have an Age header field, even if the response is already stale. A cache need not validate a response that merely became stale in transit.
trans-unit.target: “过期”响应是具有明确的过期信息或允许计算启发式过期，但根据第4.2节中的计算不是新鲜的响应。如果明确的协议内指令（例如，“无存储”或“无高速缓存”高速缓存指令，“必须重新验证”高速缓存响应指令，或适用的“ s-maxage”或“ proxy-revalidate”缓存响应指令；请参见第5.2.2节）。缓存必须发送过时的响应，除非断开连接（即，它无法联系原始服务器或以其他方式找到转发路径），或者明确允许这样做（例如，通过max-stale request指令）；见5.2.1节）。缓存应该用过期响应中的110警告代码（请参见5.5.1节）生成警告标头字段。同样，如果缓存断开连接，则缓存应在过期响应中生成112警告代码（请参见5.5.3）。当转发没有Age标头字段的响应时，即使响应已经过时，缓存也不应生成新的Warning标头字段。缓存不需要验证只是在传输过程中变得过时的响应。

trans-unit.source: A #rule extension to the ABNF rules of [RFC5234] is used to improve readability in the definitions of some header field values. A construct "#" is defined, similar to "*", for defining comma-delimited lists of elements. The full form is "<n>#<m>element" indicating at least <n> and at most <m> elements, each separated by a single comma (",") and optional whitespace (OWS). In any production that uses the list construct, a sender MUST NOT generate empty list elements. In other words, a sender MUST generate lists that satisfy the following syntax: 1#element => element *( OWS "," OWS element ) and: #element => [ 1#element ] and for n >= 1 and m > 1: <n>#<m>element => element <n-1>*<m-1>( OWS "," OWS element ) For compatibility with legacy list rules, a recipient MUST parse and ignore a reasonable number of empty list elements: enough to handle common mistakes by senders that merge values, but not so much that they could be used as a denial-of-service mechanism. In other words, a recipient MUST accept lists that satisfy the following syntax: #element => [ ( "," / element ) *( OWS "," [ OWS element ] ) ] 1#element => *( "," OWS ) element *( OWS "," [ OWS element ] ) Empty elements do not contribute to the count of elements present. For example, given these ABNF productions: example-list = 1#example-list-elmt example-list-elmt = token ; see Section 3.2.6 Then the following are valid values for example-list (not including the double quotes, which are present for delimitation only): "foo,bar" "foo ,bar," "foo , ,bar,charlie " In contrast, the following values would be invalid, since at least one non-empty element is required by the example-list production: "" "," ", ," Appendix B shows the collected ABNF for recipients after the list constructs have been expanded.
trans-unit.target: 对[ RFC5234]的ABNF规则的#rule扩展]用于提高某些标头字段值的定义中的可读性。与“ *”类似，定义了结构“＃”，用于定义以逗号分隔的元素列表。完整形式为“ <n>＃<m> element”，表示至少<n>个元素，最多为<m>个元素，每个元素由单个逗号（“，”）和可选的空格（OWS）分隔。在任何使用列表构造的产品中，发送者不得生成空列表元素。换句话说，发送者必须生成满足以下语法的列表：1＃element => element *（OWS“，” OWS element）和：#element => [1＃element]且n> = 1和m> 1：<n>＃<m> element =>元素<n-1> * <m-1>（OWS“，”OWS元素）为了与旧式列表规则兼容，接收者必须解析并忽略一定数量的空列表元素：足以处理合并值的发送者的常见错误，但不能太多以至于它们可以被用作拒绝-服务机制。换句话说，接收者必须接受满足以下语法的列表：#element => [（“，” / element）*（OWS“，” [OWS element]）] 1＃element => *（“，” OWS ）元素*（OWS“，” [OWS元素]）空元素不会增加当前元素的数量。例如，给定这些ABNF产生：example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到接收者必须解析并忽略一定数量的空列表元素：足以处理合并值的发送者的常见错误，但不能太多以至于可以将它们用作拒绝服务机制。换句话说，接收者必须接受满足以下语法的列表：#element => [（“，” / element）*（OWS“，” [OWS element]）] 1＃element => *（“，” OWS ）元素*（OWS“，” [OWS元素]）空元素不会增加当前元素的数量。例如，给定这些ABNF产生：example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到接收者必须解析并忽略一定数量的空列表元素：足以处理合并值的发送者的常见错误，但不能太多以至于可以将它们用作拒绝服务机制。换句话说，接收者必须接受满足以下语法的列表：#element => [（“，” / element）*（OWS“，” [OWS element]）] 1＃element => *（“，” OWS ）元素*（OWS“，” [OWS元素]）空元素不会增加当前元素的数量。例如，给定这些ABNF产生：example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到接收者必须接受满足以下语法的列表：#element => [（“，” / element）*（OWS“，” [OWS element]）] 1＃element => *（“，” OWS）元素*（ OWS“，” [OWS元素]）空元素不会增加当前元素的数量。例如，给定这些ABNF产生：example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到接收者必须接受满足以下语法的列表：#element => [（“，” / element）*（OWS“，” [OWS element]）] 1＃element => *（“，” OWS）元素*（ OWS“，” [OWS元素]）空元素不会增加当前元素的数量。例如，给定这些ABNF产生：example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到example-list = 1＃example-list-elmt example-list-elmt =令牌；看到3.2.6节 然后，以下是example-list的有效值（不包括双引号，仅用于分隔符）：“ foo，bar”“ foo，bar，”“ foo，，bar，charlie” ，以下值将无效，因为示例列表生成需要至少一个非空元素：“”“，”，“，” 附录B显示了在扩展列表构造之后为接收者收集的ABNF。

trans-unit.source: A 404 status code does not indicate whether the resource is temporarily or permanently missing. But if a resource is permanently removed, a 410 (Gone) should be used instead of a 404 status.
trans-unit.target: 404状态代码不指示资源是暂时还是永久丢失。但是，如果资源被永久删除，则应使用 410 （消失）而不是404状态。

trans-unit.source: A 501 error is not something you can fix, but requires a fix by the web server you are trying to access.
trans-unit.target: 501错误不是你能解决的,而是需要你试图访问的Web服务器进行修复。

trans-unit.source: A 501 response is cacheable by default.
A 501 response is cacheable by default; that is, unless caching headers instruct otherwise.
A Retry-After header might be included to this response indicating how long to wait before making a new request.
trans-unit.target: 一个 Retry-After 头部可能包括该回复表示多久作出新的请求前等待。

trans-unit.source: A 200 (OK) status code if the action has been enacted and the response message includes a representation describing the status.
trans-unit.target: 阿 200 （ OK 如果动作已经颁布）的状态码和所述响应消息包括描述状态的表示。

trans-unit.source: A 202 (Accepted) status code if the action will likely succeed but has not yet been enacted.
trans-unit.target: 一个 202 （ Accepted ）状态代码，如果动作可能会成功，但尚未颁布。

trans-unit.source: A 204 (No Content) status code if the action has been enacted and no further information is to be supplied.
trans-unit.target: 阿 204 （ No Content 如果动作已经颁布）状态代码并且没有进一步的信息要被提供。

trans-unit.source: A relative (to the request URL) or absolute URL.
trans-unit.target: 甲相对（该请求URL）或绝对 URL。

trans-unit.source: A relative (to the request URL) or absolute URL.

A status code, indicating if the request has been successful, or not, and why.
trans-unit.target: 一个状态代码，表示如果请求已成功，或没有，以及为什么。

trans-unit.source: A status code, indicating if the request was successful, or not, and why.

A <cookie-name> can be any US-ASCII characters except control characters (CTLs), spaces, or tabs. It also must not contain a separator character like the following: ( ) < > @ , ; : \ " /  [ ] ? = { }.
trans-unit.target: 甲 <cookie-name> 可以是除控制字符（CTL）的，空格或制表符任何US-ASCII字符。它还不能包含如下分隔符： ( ) < > @ , ; : \ " /  [ ] ? = { } 。

trans-unit.source: A <cookie-name> can be any US-ASCII characters, except control characters, spaces, or tabs. It also must not contain a separator character like the following: ( ) < > @ , ; : \ " / [ ] ? = { }.

A <cookie-value> can optionally be set in double quotes and any US-ASCII characters excluding CTLs, whitespace, double quotes, comma, semicolon, and backslash are allowed. Encoding: Many implementations perform URL encoding on cookie values, however it is not required per the RFC specification. It does help satisfying the requirements about which characters are allowed for <cookie-value> though.
trans-unit.target: 甲 <cookie-value> 可任选地在双引号和排除的CTL，空白，双引号，逗号，分号任何US-ASCII字符被设置，并且反斜杠是允许的。编码：许多实现都对Cookie值执行URL编码，但是RFC规范不是必需的。它确实有助于满足有关<cookie-value>允许使用哪些字符的要求。

trans-unit.source: A <cookie-value> can optionally be wrapped in double quotes and include any US-ASCII characters excluding control characters, Whitespace, double quotes, comma, semicolon, and backslash. Encoding: Many implementations perform URL encoding on cookie values, however it is not required per the RFC specification. It does help satisfying the requirements about which characters are allowed for <cookie-value> though.
A Push-Policy defines the server behaviour regarding push when processing a request.
trans-unit.target: 一个 Push-Policy 定义了处理请求时，就推服务器行为。

trans-unit.source: A Host header field must be sent in all HTTP/1.1 request messages. A 400 (Bad Request) status code may be sent to any HTTP/1.1 request message that lacks a Host header field or that contains more than one.

A Host header field must be sent in all HTTP/1.1 request messages. A 400 (Bad Request) status code will be sent to any HTTP/1.1 request message that lacks a Host header field or contains more than one.
trans-unit.target: 甲 Host 头字段必须在所有HTTP / 1.1请求消息被发送。阿 400 （错误请求）状态代码将被发送到一个缺乏任何HTTP / 1.1请求消息 Host 头字段或包含多于一个。

trans-unit.source: A Large-Allocation header was ignored due to the document not being loaded out of process.
trans-unit.target: 甲 Large-Allocation 头是由于过程的没有被加载出文档忽略。

trans-unit.source: A Large-Allocation header was ignored due to the load being triggered by a non-GET request.
trans-unit.target: 甲 Large-Allocation 头被忽略由于负载由一个非GET请求触发。

trans-unit.source: A Large-Allocation header was ignored due to the presence of windows which have a reference to this browsing context through the frame hierarchy or window.opener.
trans-unit.target: 甲 Large-Allocation 头是由于其具有穿过所述框架的层次结构或参照该浏览上下文窗口的存在忽略 window.opener 。

trans-unit.source: A PATCH is not necessarily idempotent, although it can be. Contrast this with PUT; which is always idempotent. The word "idempotent" means that any number of repeated, identical requests will leave the resource in the same state. For example if an auto-incrementing counter field is an integral part of the resource, then a PUT will naturally overwrite it (since it overwrites everything), but not necessarily so for PATCH.
A PATCH request is considered a set of instructions on how to modify a resource. Contrast this with PUT; which is a complete representation of a resource.

trans-unit.source: A data URL provides a file within a file, which can potentially be very wide relative to the width of the enclosing document. As a URL, the data should be formatable with whitespace (linefeed, tab, or spaces), but there are practical issues that arise when using base64 encoding.
trans-unit.target: 甲 data URL提供一个文件内的文件，它可以潜在地是非常宽相对于关闭文档的宽度。作为URL， data 应该可以用空格（换行符，制表符或空格）格式化，但是使用base64编码时会出现实际问题。

trans-unit.source: A multipart/form-data body requires a Content-Disposition header to provide information for each subpart of the form (e.g. for every form field and any files that are part of field data). The first directive is always form-data, and the header must also include a name parameter to identify the relevant field. Additional directives are case-insensitive and have arguments that use quoted-string syntax after the '=' sign. Multiple parameters are separated by a semi-colon (';').
A name with a value of '_charset_' indicates that the part is not an HTML field, but the default charset to use for parts without explicit charset information.
trans-unit.target: 一个 name 与值 '_charset_' 表示该部分不是HTML场，但默认字符集，而无需显式的字符集信息使用的部分。

trans-unit.source: A product token is a name followed by a '/' and a version number, like Firefox/4.0.1. There may be as many of them as the user-agent wants. A comment is a free string delimited by parentheses. Obviously parentheses cannot be used in that string. The inner format of a comment is not defined by the standard, though several browser put several tokens in it, separated by ';'.
trans-unit.target: 一个产品标记是一个名字后面标有“ / ”和一个版本号，比如 Firefox/4.0.1 。其中可能有用户代理所需的数量。一个注释是括号分隔的一个任意字符串。显然，在该字符串中不能使用括号。注释的内部格式不是由标准定义的，尽管几个浏览器在其中添加了多个标记，并用' ; 分隔。'。

trans-unit.source: A start-line describing the requests to be implemented, or its status of whether successful or a failure. This start-line is always a single line.
trans-unit.target: 一条开始线，描述要实施的请求，或者其状态（成功或失败）。此开始行始终是一行。

trans-unit.source: A status code, indicating success or failure of the request. Common status codes are 200, 404, or 302
trans-unit.target: 甲状态码，指示请求的成功或失败。常见的状态代码为 200 ， 404 ，或 302

trans-unit.source: A status text. A brief, purely informational, textual description of the status code to help a human understand the HTTP message.
trans-unit.target: 一个状态文本。状态码的简短，纯信息性的文本描述，以帮助人们理解HTTP消息。

trans-unit.source: A Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type is a standard that indicates the nature and format of a document, file, or assortment of bytes. It is defined and standardized in IETF RFC 6838.
trans-unit.target: 甲多用途互联网邮件扩展（MIME）类型是一种标准，指示文档，文件或字节的品种的性质和格式。它在IETF RFC 6838中定义和标准化。

trans-unit.source: A media type (also known as a Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions or MIME type) is a standard that indicates the nature and format of a document, file, or assortment of bytes. It is defined and standardized in IETF's RFC 6838.

A COPY method invocation MUST NOT duplicate any write locks active on the source. However, as previously noted, if the COPY copies the resource into a collection that is locked with a depth-infinity lock, then the resource will be added to the lock. A successful MOVE request on a write locked resource MUST NOT move the write lock with the resource. However, if there is an existing lock at the destination, the server MUST add the moved resource to the destination lock scope. For example, if the MOVE makes the resource a child of a collection that has a depth-infinity lock, then the resource will be added to that collection's lock. Additionally, if a resource with a depth-infinity lock is moved to a destination that is within the scope of the same lock (e.g., within the URL namespace tree covered by the lock), the moved resource will again be added to the lock. In both these examples, as specified in Section 7.5, an If header must be submitted containing a lock token for both the source and destination.
trans-unit.target: COPY方法调用不得复制任何在源上活动的写锁。但是，如前所述，如果COPY将资源复制到使用深度无限锁锁定的集合中，则该资源将被添加到该锁中。在写锁定资源上成功的MOVE请求绝不能随资源一起移动写锁定。但是，如果目标上已有锁，则服务器必须将移动的资源添加到目标锁范围。例如，如果MOVE使资源成为具有深度无限锁定的集合的子代，则资源将被添加到该集合的锁定中。此外，如果将具有深度无穷大锁定的资源移至同一锁定范围内的目标（例如，在该锁所覆盖的URL名称空间树中），移动的资源将再次添加到该锁中。在这两个示例中，如 7.5节，必须提交If头，其中包含源和目标的锁定令牌。

trans-unit.source: A Condition that consists of a single entity-tag or state-token evaluates to true if the resource matches the described state (where the individual matching functions are defined below in Section 10.4.4). Prefixing it with "Not" reverses the result of the evaluation (thus, the "Not" applies only to the subsequent entity-tag or state-token). Each List production describes a series of conditions. The whole list evaluates to true if and only if each condition evaluates to true (that is, the list represents a logical conjunction of Conditions). Each No-tag-list and Tagged-list production may contain one or more Lists. They evaluate to true if and only if any of the contained lists evaluates to true (that is, if there's more than one List, that List sequence represents a logical disjunction of the Lists). Finally, the whole If header evaluates to true if and only if at least one of the No-tag-list or Tagged-list productions evaluates to true. If the header evaluates to false, the server MUST reject the request with a 412 (Precondition Failed) status. Otherwise, execution of the request can proceed as if the header wasn't present.
trans-unit.target: 如果资源与所描述的状态匹配（由单个匹配函数在下面的第10.4.4节中定义），则由单个实体标签或状态令牌组成的条件的评估结果为true。 ）。给它加上“ Not”前缀会反转评估结果（因此，“ Not”仅适用于后续的实体标签或状态令牌）。每个List产品都描述了一系列条件。当且仅当每个条件的评估结果为true时，整个列表的评估结果才为true（即，该列表代表“条件”的逻辑结合）。每个“无标签列表”和“标签列表”产品都可以包含一个或多个列表。当且仅当包含的任何一个列表的评估结果为true时，它们的评估结果才为true（也就是说，如果存在多个List，则该List序列表示这些列表的逻辑分离）。最后，当且仅当No-tag-list或Tagged-list生产中的至少一个评估为true时，整个If标头的评估结果才为true。如果标头的值为假，服务器必须以412（前提条件失败）状态拒绝请求。否则，可以像不存在标头一样继续执行请求。

trans-unit.source: A DAV-compliant resource can advertise several classes of compliance. A client can discover the compliance classes of a resource by executing OPTIONS on the resource and examining the "DAV" header which is returned. Note particularly that resources, rather than servers, are spoken of as being compliant. That is because theoretically some resources on a server could support different feature sets. For example, a server could have a sub-repository where an advanced feature like versioning was supported, even if that feature was not supported on all sub-repositories. Since this document describes extensions to the HTTP/1.1 protocol, minimally all DAV-compliant resources, clients, and proxies MUST be compliant with [RFC2616]. A resource that is class 2 or class 3 compliant must also be class 1 compliant.
trans-unit.target: 符合DAV的资源可以宣告几种合规性。客户端可以通过在资源上执行OPTIONS并检查返回的“ DAV”标头来发现资源的符合性类。特别要注意的是，资源而不是服务器是合规的。这是因为理论上服务器上的某些资源可以支持不同的功能集。例如，服务器可能有一个子存储库，其中支持诸如版本控制之类的高级功能，即使并非所有子存储库均支持该功能。由于本文档描述了HTTP / 1.1协议的扩展，因此，至少所有符合DAV的资源，客户端和代理都必须符合[ RFC2616]。符合2级或3级标准的资源也必须符合1级标准。

trans-unit.source:
A LOCK request to an existing resource will create a lock on the resource identified by the Request-URI, provided the resource is not already locked with a conflicting lock. The resource identified in the Request-URI becomes the root of the lock. LOCK method requests to create a new lock MUST have an XML request body. The server MUST preserve the information provided by the client in the 'owner' element in the LOCK request. The LOCK request MAY have a Timeout header.
When a new lock is created, the LOCK response:
o MUST contain a body with the value of the DAV:lockdiscovery property in a prop XML element. This MUST contain the full information about the lock just granted, while information about other (shared) locks is OPTIONAL.
o MUST include the Lock-Token response header with the token associated with the new lock.
trans-unit.target: 对现有资源的LOCK请求将在Request-URI所标识的资源上创建一个锁,前提是该资源尚未被冲突的锁锁定。Request-URI中标识的资源成为锁的根。创建新锁的LOCK方法请求必须有一个XML请求体。服务器必须保留客户端在LOCK请求中的 "所有者 "元素中提供的信息。LOCK请求可以有一个超时头。当一个新的锁被创建时,LOCK响应:o必须包含一个主体,在prop XML元素中包含DAV:lockdiscovery属性的值。o MUST包含一个带有与新锁相关联的令牌的Lock-Token响应头,这个头必须包含刚刚授予的锁的完整信息,而其他(共享)锁的信息是OPTIONAL。

trans-unit.source:
A Last-Modified time, when used as a validator in a request, is implicitly weak unless it is possible to deduce that it is strong, using the following rules:
o The validator is being compared by an origin server to the actual current validator for the representation and,
o That origin server reliably knows that the associated representation did not change twice during the second covered by the presented validator.
or
o The validator is about to be used by a client in an If-Modified-Since, If-Unmodified-Since, or If-Range header field, because the client has a cache entry for the associated representation, and
o That cache entry includes a Date value, which gives the time when the origin server sent the original response, and
o The presented Last-Modified time is at least 60 seconds before the Date value.
or
o The validator is being compared by an intermediate cache to the validator stored in its cache entry for the representation, and
o That cache entry includes a Date value, which gives the time when the origin server sent the original response, and
o The presented Last-Modified time is at least 60 seconds before the Date value.
This method relies on the fact that if two different responses were sent by the origin server during the same second, but both had the same Last-Modified time, then at least one of those responses would have a Date value equal to its Last-Modified time. The arbitrary 60-second limit guards against the possibility that the Date and Last-Modified values are generated from different clocks or at somewhat different times during the preparation of the response. An implementation MAY use a value larger than 60 seconds, if it is believed that 60 seconds is too short.
trans-unit.target: Last-Modified时间,当在请求中作为验证器使用时,是隐含的弱时间,除非使用以下规则可以推断出它是强时间:o该验证器正被一个源服务器与该表示的实际当前验证器进行比较,并且,o该源服务器可靠地知道在所呈现的验证器所覆盖的第二次期间,相关的表示没有发生两次变化。或 o 该验证器即将被客户端在If-Modified-Since、If-Unmodified-Since或If-Range头字段中使用,因为客户端有一个相关表示的缓存条目,并且,o 该缓存条目包括一个Date值,该Date值给出了源服务器发送原始响应的时间,并且,o 所呈现的Last-Modified时间至少在Date值之前60秒。或 o 该验证器被中间缓存与存储在它的表示的缓存条目中的验证器进行比较,并且 o 该缓存条目包括一个Date值,它给出了起源服务器发送原始响应的时间,并且 o 所呈现的Last-Modified时间至少在Date值之前60秒。这种方法依赖于这样一个事实,即如果在同一秒内,源服务器发送了两个不同的响应,但两者的Last-Modified时间相同,那么其中至少有一个响应的Date值将等于其Last-Modified时间。任意的 60 秒限制防止了 Date 和 Last-Modified 值从不同的时钟或在准备响应期间的不同时间生成的可能性。如果认为60秒太短,实现可以使用大于60秒的值。

trans-unit.source: A MIME type consists of a type and a subtype — two strings separated by /. No whitespace is allowed. The type represents the category and can be a discrete or a multipart type. The subtype is specific to each type.
trans-unit.target: MIME类型由一个类型和一个子类型组成-两个字符串用 / 分隔。不允许使用空格。该类型表示类别，并且可以是离散类型或多部分类型。该亚型是特定于每个类型。

trans-unit.source: A MIME type, but without any subtype. image/* will match image/png, image/svg, image/gif and any other image types.
trans-unit.target: MIME类型，但没有任何子类型。 image/* 将匹配 image/png ， image/svg ， image/gif 和任何其他图像类型。

trans-unit.source: A MOVE with "Depth: infinity" instructs that the collection identified by the Request-URI be moved to the address specified in the Destination header, and all resources identified by its internal member URLs are to be moved to locations relative to it, recursively through all levels of the collection hierarchy. The MOVE method on a collection MUST act as if a "Depth: infinity" header was used on it. A client MUST NOT submit a Depth header on a MOVE on a collection with any value but "infinity". Any headers included with MOVE MUST be applied in processing every resource to be moved with the exception of the Destination header. The behavior of the Destination header is the same as given for COPY on collections. When the MOVE method has completed processing, it MUST have created a consistent URL namespace at both the source and destination (see Section 5.1 for the definition of namespace consistency). However, if an error occurs while moving an internal collection, the server MUST NOT move any resources identified by members of the failed collection (i.e., the server must skip the error-causing subtree), as this would create an inconsistent namespace. In this case, after detecting the error, the move operation SHOULD try to finish as much of the original move as possible (i.e., the server should still attempt to move other subtrees and the resources identified by their members that are not descendants of an error-causing collection). So, for example, if an infinite-depth move is performed on collection /a/, which contains collections /a/b/ and /a/c/, and an error occurs moving /a/b/, an attempt should still be made to try moving /a/c/. Similarly, after encountering an error moving a non-collection resource as part of an infinite-depth move, the server SHOULD try to finish as much of the original move operation as possible. If an error occurs with a resource other than the resource identified in the Request-URI, then the response MUST be a 207 (Multi-Status), and the errored resource's URL MUST appear with the specific error. The 424 (Failed Dependency) status code SHOULD NOT be returned in the 207 (Multi-Status) response from a MOVE method. These errors can be safely omitted because the client will know that the progeny of a resource could not be moved when the client receives an error for the parent. Additionally, 201 (Created)/204 (No Content) responses SHOULD NOT be returned as values in 207 (Multi-Status) responses from a MOVE. These responses can be safely omitted because they are the default success codes.
trans-unit.target: 带有“深度：无穷大”的MOVE指示将Request-URI标识的集合移动到Destination标头中指定的地址，并且将其内部成员URL标识的所有资源都通过递归地移动到相对于其的位置集合层次结构的所有级别。集合上的MOVE方法必须像在其上使用“深度：无限”标头一样起作用。客户绝不能在MOVE上的集合中提交Depth头，该头的值必须是“ infinity”。 MOVE附带的任何报头必须用于处理要移动的每个资源，但目的地报头除外。 Destination标头的行为与对集合的COPY给出的行为相同。当MOVE方法完成处理后，它必须在源和目标处都创建了一致的URL名称空间（请参见 第5.1节（用于命名空间一致性的定义）。但是，如果在移动内部集合时发生错误，则服务器不得移动由失败的集合的成员标识的任何资源（即服务器必须跳过导致错误的子树），因为这会导致名称空间不一致。在这种情况下，在检测到错误之后，移动操作应尝试完成尽可能多的原始移动（即，服务器仍应尝试移动不是错误后代的其他子树及其成员标识的资源-导致收集）。因此，例如，如果对包含集合/ a / b /和/ a / c /的集合/ a /执行无限深度移动，并且在移动/ a / b /时发生错误，则仍应尝试尝试移动/ a / c /。同样，在无限深度移动中移动非集合资源遇到错误后，服务器应尝试完成尽可能多的原始移动操作。如果除请求URI中标识的资源以外的其他资源发生错误，则响应必须为207（多状态），并且出现错误的资源的URL必须带有特定的错误。从MOVE方法的207（多状态）响应中不应返回424（依赖关系失败）状态码。这些错误可以安全地省略，因为当客户端收到父级的错误时，客户端将知道无法移动资源的后代。另外，不应从MOVE中返回201（已创建）/ 204（无内容）响应作为207（多状态）响应中的值。可以安全地忽略这些响应，因为它们是默认的成功代码。

trans-unit.source: A Multi-Status response conveys information about multiple resources in situations where multiple status codes might be appropriate. The default Multi-Status response body is a text/xml or application/xml HTTP entity with a 'multistatus' root element. Further elements contain 200, 300, 400, and 500 series status codes generated during the method invocation. 100 series status codes SHOULD NOT be recorded in a 'response' XML element. Although '207' is used as the overall response status code, the recipient needs to consult the contents of the multistatus response body for further information about the success or failure of the method execution. The response MAY be used in success, partial success and also in failure situations. The 'multistatus' root element holds zero or more 'response' elements in any order, each with information about an individual resource. Each 'response' element MUST have an 'href' element to identify the resource. A Multi-Status response uses one out of two distinct formats for representing the status: 1. A 'status' element as child of the 'response' element indicates the status of the message execution for the identified resource as a whole (for instance, see Section 9.6.2). Some method definitions provide information about specific status codes clients should be prepared to see in a response. However, clients MUST be able to handle other status codes, using the generic rules defined in Section 10 of [RFC2616]. 2. For PROPFIND and PROPPATCH, the format has been extended using the 'propstat' element instead of 'status', providing information about individual properties of a resource. This format is specific to PROPFIND and PROPPATCH, and is described in detail in Sections 9.1 and 9.2.
trans-unit.target: 在多个状态代码可能适用的情况下，多状态响应传达有关多个资源的信息。默认的多状态响应主体是带有'multistatus'根元素的text / xml或application / xml HTTP实体。其他元素包含在方法调用期间生成的200、300、400和500系列状态代码。 100系列状态码不应记录在“响应” XML元素中。尽管将“ 207”用作整体响应状态代码，但是接收者需要咨询多状态响应主体的内容，以获取有关方法执行成功或失败的更多信息。该响应可以用于成功，部分成功以及失败情况下。 “多状态”根元素以任何顺序包含零个或多个“响应”元素，每个元素都包含有关单个资源的信息。每个“响应”元素必须有一个“ href”元素来标识资源。多重状态响应使用两种不同格式中的一种来表示状态：1.作为“响应”元素的子元素的“状态”元素指示整个已标识资源的消息执行状态（例如，看到元素，作为“响应”元素的子元素，指示整个已标识资源的消息执行状态（例如，请参见元素，作为“响应”元素的子元素，指示整个已标识资源的消息执行状态（例如，请参见9.6.2节）。一些方法定义提供有关客户端应准备在响应中查看的特定状态代码的信息。但是，客户端必须能够使用[RFC2616]第10节中定义的通用规则来处理其他状态代码。 2.对于PROPFIND和PROPPATCH，使用'propstat'元素而不是'status'扩展了格式，提供了有关资源的各个属性的信息。该格式特定于PROPFIND和PROPPATCH，并在9.1和9.2节中进行了详细说明。

trans-unit.source: A Multi-Status response conveys information about multiple resources in situations where multiple status codes might be appropriate.
trans-unit.target: 多状态响应在可能适合使用多种状态代码的情况下,传递有关多种资源的信息。

trans-unit.source:
A PUT performed on an existing resource replaces the GET response entity of the resource. Properties defined on the resource may be recomputed during PUT processing but are not otherwise affected. For example, if a server recognizes the content type of the request body, it may be able to automatically extract information that could be profitably exposed as properties.
A PUT that would result in the creation of a resource without an appropriately scoped parent collection MUST fail with a 409 (Conflict).
A PUT request allows a client to indicate what media type an entity body has, and whether it should change if overwritten. Thus, a client SHOULD provide a Content-Type for a new resource if any is known. If the client does not provide a Content-Type for a new resource, the server MAY create a resource with no Content-Type assigned, or it MAY attempt to assign a Content-Type.
Note that although a recipient ought generally to treat metadata supplied with an HTTP request as authoritative, in practice there's no guarantee that a server will accept client-supplied metadata (e.g., any request header beginning with "Content-"). Many servers do not allow configuring the Content-Type on a per-resource basis in the first place. Thus, clients can't always rely on the ability to directly influence the content type by including a Content-Type request header.
trans-unit.target: 在现有资源上执行的PUT会替换资源的GET响应实体。在PUT处理过程中,资源上定义的属性可能会被重新计算,但不会受到其他影响。例如,如果服务器识别了请求主体的内容类型,它就可以自动提取可以作为属性而获利的信息。一个PUT如果会导致创建一个没有适当范围的父集合的资源,则必须以409(冲突)失败。PUT请求允许客户机指示实体体的媒体类型,以及如果被覆盖,它是否应该改变。因此,如果已知有新资源,客户端应该为其提供Content-Type。如果客户机没有为新资源提供Content-Type,服务器可以创建一个没有分配Content-Type的资源,或者它可以尝试分配一个Content-Type。请注意,虽然接收者通常应该将HTTP请求中提供的元数据视为权威数据,但实际上并不能保证服务器会接受客户端提供的元数据(例如,任何以 "Content-"开头的请求头)。许多服务器首先不允许在每个资源的基础上配置Content-Type。因此,客户端不能总是依赖通过包含Content-Type请求头来直接影响内容类型的能力。

trans-unit.source: A Resource whose IRI is listed in a Collection is called a Member Resource. The protocol defines two kinds of Member Resources -- Entry Resources and Media Resources. Entry Resources are represented as Atom Entry Documents [RFC4287]. Media Resources can have representations in any media type. A Media Resource is described within a Collection using an Entry called a Media Link Entry. This diagram shows the classification of Resources within the Atom Protocol: Member Resources | ----------------- | | Entry Resources Media Resources | Media Link Entry The Atom Protocol defines Collection Resources for managing and organizing both kinds of Member Resource. A Collection is represented by an Atom Feed Document. A Collection Feed's Entries contain the IRIs of, and metadata about, the Collection's Member Resources. A Collection Feed can contain any number of Entries, which might represent all the Members of the Collection, or an ordered subset of them (see Section 10.1). In the diagram of a Collection below, there are two Entries. The first contains the IRI of an Entry Resource. The second contains the IRIs of both a Media Resource and a Media Link Entry, which contains the metadata for that Media Resource: Collection | o- Entry | | | o- Member Entry IRI (Entry Resource) | o- Entry | o- Member Entry IRI (Media Link Entry) | o- Media IRI (Media Resource) The Atom Protocol does not make a distinction between Feeds used for Collections and other Atom Feeds. The only mechanism that this specification supplies for indicating that a Feed is a Collection Feed is the presence of the Feed's IRI in a Service Document. Service Documents represent server-defined groups of Collections, and are used to initialize the process of creating and editing Resources. These groups of Collections are called Workspaces. Workspaces have names, but no IRIs, and no specified processing model. The Service Document can indicate which media types, and which categories, a Collection will accept. In the diagram below, there are two Workspaces each describing the IRIs, acceptable media types, and categories for a Collection: Service o- Workspace | | | o- Collection | | | o- IRI, categories, media types | o- Workspace | o- Collection | o- IRI, categories, media types
trans-unit.target: IRI在集合中列出的资源称为成员资源。该协议定义了两种成员资源-条目资源和媒体资源。条目资源表示为Atom条目文档[ RFC4287]。媒体资源可以具有任何媒体类型的表示形式。媒体资源是在集合中使用称为媒体链接条目的条目来描述的。该图显示了Atom协议中资源的分类：成员资源| ----------------- | |入门资源媒体资源|媒体链接条目Atom协议定义了收集资源，用于管理和组织两种成员资源。集合由Atom Feed文档表示。集合提要的条目包含集合的成员资源的IRI和元数据。集合供稿可以包含任意数量的条目，它可能代表集合的所有成员，或者代表它们的有序子集（请参见第10.1节）。在下面的集合图中，有两个条目。第一个包含条目资源的IRI。第二个包含媒体资源和媒体链接条目的IRI，其中包含该媒体资源的元数据。 o-进入| | | o-成员条目IRI（条目资源）| o-进入| o-成员条目IRI（媒体链接条目）| o- Media IRI（媒体资源）Atom协议没有在用于集合的提要和其他Atom提要之间进行区分。该规范提供的唯一指示提要是集合提要的机制是服务文档中提要的IRI的存在。服务文档代表服务器定义的集合组，并用于初始化创建和编辑资源的过程。这些集合组称为工作区。工作区具有名称，但没有IRI，也没有指定的处理模型。服务文档可以指示集合将接受的媒体类型和类别。在下图中，有两个工作区，每个工作区都描述了IRI，可接受的媒体类型和集合的类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型并用于初始化创建和编辑资源的过程。这些集合组称为工作区。工作区具有名称，但没有IRI，也没有指定的处理模型。服务文档可以指示集合将接受的媒体类型和类别。在下图中，有两个工作区，每个工作区都描述了IRI，可接受的媒体类型和集合的类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型并用于初始化创建和编辑资源的过程。这些集合组称为工作区。工作区具有名称，但没有IRI，也没有指定的处理模型。服务文档可以指示集合将接受的媒体类型和类别。在下图中，有两个工作区，每个工作区都描述了IRI，可接受的媒体类型和集合的类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型工作区具有名称，但没有IRI，也没有指定的处理模型。服务文档可以指示集合将接受的媒体类型和类别。在下图中，有两个工作区，每个工作区都描述了IRI，可接受的媒体类型和集合的类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型工作区具有名称，但没有IRI，也没有指定的处理模型。服务文档可以指示集合将接受的媒体类型和类别。在下图中，有两个工作区，每个工作区都描述了IRI，可接受的媒体类型和集合的类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型集合的可接受媒体类型和类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型集合的可接受媒体类型和类别：服务o-工作区| | | o-系列| | | o- IRI，类别，媒体类型| o-工作区| o-系列| o- IRI，类别，媒体类型

trans-unit.source:
A Service Document groups Collections into Workspaces. Operations on Workspaces, such as creation or deletion, are not defined by this specification. This specification assigns no meaning to Workspaces; that is, a Workspace does not imply any specific processing assumptions.
There is no requirement that a server support multiple Workspaces. In addition, a Collection MAY appear in more than one Workspace.
trans-unit.target: 服务文档将集合归入 "工作空间"。本规范没有定义对工作空间的操作,如创建或删除。本规范没有给工作空间赋予任何意义;也就是说,一个工作空间并不意味着任何具体的处理假设。没有要求服务器支持多个工作空间。此外,一个集合可以出现在一个以上的工作空间中。

A URI where to POST the report to.
trans-unit.target: 一个URI,用于将报告发布到哪里。
