trans-unit.source: A Uniform Resource Name (URN) is a URI that identifies a resource by name in a particular namespace.
trans-unit.target: 统一资源名称(URN)是一个URI,它通过名称来标识特定命名空间中的资源。

trans-unit.source: A Web page is a hypertext document. This means some parts of displayed text are links which can be activated (usually by a click of the mouse) to fetch a new Web page, allowing the user to direct their user-agent and navigate through the Web. The browser translates these directions in HTTP requests, and further interprets the HTTP responses to present the user with a clear response.
trans-unit.target: 一个网页是一个超文本文件。这意味着显示的文本中的某些部分是链接,可以激活这些链接(通常是通过点击鼠标)来获取一个新的网页,允许用户引导他们的用户代理,并在网络中导航。浏览器将这些指示翻译成HTTP请求,并进一步解释HTTP响应,为用户呈现一个清晰的响应。

trans-unit.source: A WebDAV client implemented to this specification might find servers that create lock-null resources (implemented before this specification using [RFC2518]) as well as servers that create locked empty resources. The response to the LOCK request will not indicate what kind of resource was created. There are a few techniques that help the client deal with either type. If the client wishes to avoid accidentally creating either lock- null or empty locked resources, an "If-Match: *" header can be included with LOCK requests to prevent the server from creating a new resource. If a LOCK request creates a resource and the client subsequently wants to overwrite that resource using a COPY or MOVE request, the client should include an "Overwrite: T" header. If a LOCK request creates a resource and the client then decides to get rid of that resource, a DELETE request is supposed to fail on a lock-null resource and UNLOCK should be used instead. But with a locked empty resource, UNLOCK doesn't make the resource disappear. Therefore, the client might have to try both requests and ignore an error in one of the two requests.
trans-unit.target: 按照此规范实施的WebDAV客户端可能会找到创建锁空资源的服务器（在此规范之前使用[ RFC2518]）以及创建锁定的空资源的服务器。对LOCK请求的响应不会指示创建了哪种资源。有几种技术可以帮助客户端处理这两种类型。如果客户端希望避免意外地创建空锁或空锁资源，可以在LOCK请求中包含“ If-Match：*”标头，以防止服务器创建新资源。如果LOCK请求创建了一个资源，并且客户端随后想要使用COPY或MOVE请求覆盖该资源，则客户端应包括“ Overwrite：T”标头。如果LOCK请求创建了一个资源，然后客户端决定摆脱该资源，一个DELETE请求应该在锁空资源上失败，而应该使用UNLOCK。但是对于锁定的空资源，UNLOCK不会使资源消失。因此，客户端可能必须尝试两个请求，而忽略两个请求之一中的错误。

trans-unit.source:
A WebDAV-compliant resource is not required to support locking in any form. If the resource does support locking, it may choose to support any combination of exclusive and shared locks for any access types.
The reason for this flexibility is that locking policy strikes to the very heart of the resource management and versioning systems employed by various storage repositories. These repositories require control over what sort of locking will be made available. For example, some repositories only support shared write locks, while others only provide support for exclusive write locks, while yet others use no locking at all. As each system is sufficiently different to merit exclusion of certain locking features, this specification leaves locking as the sole axis of negotiation within WebDAV.
trans-unit.target: 符合WebDAV的资源不需要支持任何形式的锁定。如果资源支持锁定,它可以选择支持任何访问类型的独占和共享锁的任何组合。之所以具有这种灵活性,是因为锁定策略切中了各种存储库所采用的资源管理和版本系统的要害。这些存储库需要控制什么样的锁将被提供。例如,一些存储库只支持共享的写锁,而另一些存储库只提供独占的写锁的支持,还有一些存储库完全不使用锁。由于每个系统都有足够的差异,因此需要排除某些锁定功能,本规范将锁定作为WebDAV内唯一的协商轴。

trans-unit.source: A blank line indicating all meta-information for the request has been sent.
A blank line indicating all meta-information for the request have been sent.
trans-unit.target: 空行表示该请求的所有元信息都已发送。

trans-unit.source: A boolean that indicates the user agent's preference for reduced data usage.
A brief description of the changes between the early versions of HTTP, to the modern HTTP/2 and beyond.
trans-unit.target: 简单介绍一下从早期的HTTP版本,到现代的HTTP/2及以后的变化。

trans-unit.source: A brief description of the changes between the early versions of HTTP, to the modern HTTP/2, the emergent HTTP/3 and beyond.
A brief introduction of the notion of resources, identifiers, and locations on the Web.
trans-unit.target: 简单介绍一下网络上资源、标识符和位置的概念。

trans-unit.source: A brief introduction to the concept of resources, identifiers, and locations on the web.

A cache MUST NOT store a response to any request, unless: o The request method is understood by the cache and defined as being cacheable, and o the response status code is understood by the cache, and o the "no-store" cache directive (see Section 5.2) does not appear in request or response header fields, and o the "private" response directive (see Section 5.2.2.6) does not appear in the response, if the cache is shared, and o the Authorization header field (see Section 4.2 of [RFC7235]) does not appear in the request, if the cache is shared, unless the response explicitly allows it (see Section 3.2), and o the response either: * contains an Expires header field (see Section 5.3), or * contains a max-age response directive (see Section 5.2.2.8), or * contains a s-maxage response directive (see Section 5.2.2.9) and the cache is shared, or * contains a Cache Control Extension (see Section 5.2.3) that allows it to be cached, or * has a status code that is defined as cacheable by default (see Section 4.2.2), or * contains a public response directive (see Section 5.2.2.5). Note that any of the requirements listed above can be overridden by a cache-control extension; see Section 5.2.3. In this context, a cache has "understood" a request method or a response status code if it recognizes it and implements all specified caching-related behavior. Note that, in normal operation, some caches will not store a response that has neither a cache validator nor an explicit expiration time, as such responses are not usually useful to store. However, caches are not prohibited from storing such responses.
trans-unit.target: 高速缓存绝不能存储对任何请求的响应，除非：o高速缓存可以理解请求方法并将其定义为可高速缓存，并且高速缓存可以理解响应状态代码，以及“ no-store”高速缓存指令（请参阅第5.2节）不会出现在请求或响应标头字段中，并且如果共享了缓存，则“私有”响应指令（请参阅第5.2.2.6节）也不会出现在响应中，并且o授权标头字段（如果共享了缓存，请参阅[RFC7235]的4.2节）不会出现在请求中，除非响应明确允许它（请参阅3.2节），并且o响应之一：*包含Expires标头字段（请参见第5.3节），或*包含max-age响应指令（请参阅第5.2.2.8节），或*包含s-maxage响应指令（请参阅第5.2.2.9节），并且缓存是共享的，或者*包含缓存控制扩展（请参阅第5.2.3节）以允许对其进行缓存，或*具有默认定义为可缓存的状态代码（请参阅 第4.2.2节），或*包含公共响应指令（请参阅第5.2.2.5节）。请注意，上面列出的任何要求都可以由缓存控制扩展覆盖。见5.2.3节。在这种情况下，如果缓存能够识别并实现所有指定的与缓存相关的行为，则它“了解”了请求方法或响应状态代码。请注意，在正常操作中，某些缓存不会存储既没有缓存验证器也没有明确的到期时间的响应，因为此类响应通常对存储没有用。但是，不禁止高速缓存存储此类响应。

trans-unit.source: A cache SHOULD generate this if it heuristically chose a freshness lifetime greater than 24 hours and the response's age is greater than 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: 缓存如果启发式地选择了大于24小时的新鲜度寿命,并且响应的年龄大于24小时,就会产生这个。

trans-unit.source: A cache SHOULD generate this if it is intentionally disconnected from the rest of the network for a period of time.
trans-unit.target: 如果一个缓存在一段时间内有意与网络的其他部分断开连接,就应该产生这个。

trans-unit.source: A cache SHOULD generate this when sending a stale response because an attempt to validate the response failed, due to an inability to reach the server.
trans-unit.target: 当发送一个陈旧的响应时,由于无法到达服务器而导致验证响应的尝试失败,缓存应该产生这个。

trans-unit.source: A cache SHOULD generate this whenever the sent response is stale.
trans-unit.target: 每当发送的响应是陈旧的,缓存就会产生这个。

trans-unit.source: A cache can calculate the freshness lifetime (denoted as freshness_lifetime) of a response by using the first match of the following: o If the cache is shared and the s-maxage response directive (Section 5.2.2.9) is present, use its value, or o If the max-age response directive (Section 5.2.2.8) is present, use its value, or o If the Expires response header field (Section 5.3) is present, use its value minus the value of the Date response header field, or o Otherwise, no explicit expiration time is present in the response. A heuristic freshness lifetime might be applicable; see Section 4.2.2. Note that this calculation is not vulnerable to clock skew, since all of the information comes from the origin server. When there is more than one value present for a given directive (e.g., two Expires header fields, multiple Cache-Control: max-age directives), the directive's value is considered invalid. Caches are encouraged to consider responses that have invalid freshness information to be stale.
trans-unit.target: 高速缓存可以使用以下内容的第一个匹配项来计算响应的新鲜度生存期（表示为Freshness_lifetime）：o如果高速缓存是共享的并且存在s-maxage response指令（第5.2.2.9节），请使用其值，或o如果存在max-age响应指令（第5.2.2.8节），请使用其值，或者o如果存在Expires响应头字段（第5.3节），请使用其值减去日期响应头字段的值，或o否则，响应中没有明确的到期时间。启发式新鲜度寿命可能适用；见 4.2.2节。请注意，此计算不容易受到时钟偏斜的影响，因为所有信息都来自原始服务器。当给定指令存在多个值时（例如，两个Expires标头字段，多个Cache-Control：max-age指令），该指令的值被视为无效。鼓励缓存将具有无效新鲜度信息的响应视为过时的。

trans-unit.source: A cache entry might also consist of multiple stored responses differentiated by a secondary key, if the request is target of content negotiation. For more details see the information about the Vary header below.
trans-unit.target: 如果请求是内容协商的目标，则高速缓存条目还可能包含多个存储的响应，这些响应由辅助键来区分。有关更多详细信息，请参见下面有关 Vary 标头的信息。

trans-unit.source: A cache that receives an incomplete response (for example, with fewer bytes of data than specified in a Content-Length header) MAY store the response. However, the cache MUST treat this as a partial response. Partial responses MAY be combined as described in section13.5.4; the result might be a full response or might still be partial. A cache MUST NOT return a partial response to a client without explicitly marking it as such, using the 206 (Partial Content) status code. A cache MUST NOT return a partial response using a status code of 200 (OK). If a cache receives a 5xx response while attempting to revalidate an entry, it MAY either forward this response to the requesting client, or act as if the server failed to respond. In the latter case, it MAY return a previously received response unless the cached entry includes the "must-revalidate" cache-control directive (see section14.9).
trans-unit.target: 接收到不完整响应的缓存（例如，数据字节数少于Content-Length头中指定的字节数）可以存储响应。但是，缓存必须将此作为部分响应。可以按照第13.5.4 节中的描述合并部分响应; 结果可能是完全响应，也可能仍然是部分响应。高速缓存不得使用206（部分内容）状态码将部分响应返回给客户端，而不必将其明确标记为客户端。缓存不得使用状态码200（OK）返回部分响应。如果一个高速缓存在试图重新验证一个条目时收到一个5xx响应，它可以将该响应转发给请求的客户端，或者像服务器响应失败一样起作用。在后一种情况下，除非缓存的条目包含“必须重新验证”缓存控制指令（参见14.9 节），否则它可能返回先前接收到的响应。

trans-unit.source: A cache will send the request to the origin server for validation before releasing a cached copy.
trans-unit.target: 缓存会将请求发送到源服务器进行验证,然后再释放缓存副本。

trans-unit.source: A character encoding name, like utf-8 or iso-8859-15.

A class 1 compliant resource MUST meet all "MUST" requirements in all sections of this document.
Class 1 compliant resources MUST return, at minimum, the value "1" in the DAV header on all responses to the OPTIONS method.
trans-unit.target: 符合 1 类的资源必须满足本文档所有章节中的所有 "必须 "要求。符合1类的资源必须在所有对OPTIONS方法的响应的DAV头中至少返回值 "1"。

trans-unit.source:
A class 2 compliant resource MUST meet all class 1 requirements and support the LOCK method, the DAV:supportedlock property, the DAV: lockdiscovery property, the Time-Out response header and the Lock- Token request header. A class 2 compliant resource SHOULD also support the Timeout request header and the 'owner' XML element.
Class 2 compliant resources MUST return, at minimum, the values "1" and "2" in the DAV header on all responses to the OPTIONS method.
trans-unit.target: 符合类 2 的资源必须满足所有类 1 的要求,并支持 LOCK 方法、DAV:supportedlock 属性、DAV:lockdiscovery 属性、Time-Out 响应头和 Lock-Token 请求头。符合2类的资源还应该支持Time-Out请求头和'owner'XML元素。符合第2类的资源必须在所有OPTIONS方法的响应中至少返回DAV头中的 "1 "和 "2 "值。

trans-unit.source:
A client MUST NOT submit the same write lock request twice. Note that a client is always aware it is resubmitting the same lock request because it must include the lock token in the If header in order to make the request for a resource that is already locked.
However, a client may submit a LOCK request with an If header but without a body. A server receiving a LOCK request with no body MUST NOT create a new lock -- this form of the LOCK request is only to be used to "refresh" an existing lock (meaning, at minimum, that any timers associated with the lock MUST be reset).
Clients may submit Timeout headers of arbitrary value with their lock refresh requests. Servers, as always, may ignore Timeout headers submitted by the client, and a server MAY refresh a lock with a timeout period that is different than the previous timeout period used for the lock, provided it advertises the new value in the LOCK refresh response.
If an error is received in response to a refresh LOCK request, the client MUST NOT assume that the lock was refreshed.
trans-unit.target: 客户端决不能两次提交同一个写锁请求。请注意,客户端总是知道它正在重新提交同一个锁请求,因为它必须在If头中包含锁标记,才能对已经锁定的资源提出请求。但是,客户端可以提交一个带有If头但没有主体的LOCK请求。接收到没有主体的LOCK请求的服务器必须不创建新的锁--这种形式的LOCK请求只能用于 "刷新 "现有的锁(这意味着,至少必须重置与锁相关的任何计时器)。客户端可以在他们的锁刷新请求中提交任意值的Timeout头。服务器可以像往常一样,忽略客户端提交的超时头,服务器可以用不同于之前锁的超时时间段来刷新锁,只要它在LOCK刷新响应中公布新的值。如果在响应刷新LOCK请求时收到一个错误,客户端绝不能认为锁被刷新了。

trans-unit.source: A client can POST Media Resources as well as Entry Resources to a Collection. If a server accepts such a request, then it MUST create two new Resources -- one that corresponds to the entity sent in the request, called the Media Resource, and an associated Member Entry, called the Media Link Entry. Media Link Entries are represented as Atom Entries, and appear in the Collection. The Media Link Entry contains the metadata and IRI of the (perhaps non-textual) Media Resource. The Media Link Entry thus makes the metadata about the Media Resource separately available for retrieval and alteration. The server can signal the media types it will accept using the app: accept element in the Service Document, as specified in Section8.3.4. Successful responses to creation requests MUST include the URI of the Media Link Entry in the Location header. The Media Link Entry SHOULD contain an atom:link element with a link relation of "edit-media" that contains the Media Resource IRI. The Media Link Entry MUST have an atom:content element with a "src" attribute. The value of the "src" attribute is an IRI for the newly created Media Resource. It is OPTIONAL that the IRI of the "src" attribute on the atom:content element be the same as the Media Resource IRI. For example, the "src" attribute value might instead be a link into a static cache or content distribution network and not the Media Resource IRI. Implementers are asked to note that [RFC4287] specifies that Atom Entries MUST contain an atom:summary element. Thus, upon successful creation of a Media Link Entry, a server MAY choose to populate the atom:summary element (as well as any other mandatory elements such as atom:id, atom:author, and atom:title) with content derived from the POSTed entity or from any other source. A server might not allow a client to modify the server-selected values for these elements. For Resource creation, this specification only defines cases where the POST body has an Atom Entry entity declared as an Atom media type ("application/atom+xml"), or a non-Atom entity declared as a non-Atom media type. When a client is POSTing an Atom Entry to a Collection, it may use a media type of either "application/atom+xml" or "application/atom +xml;type=entry". This specification does not specify any request semantics or server behavior in the case where the POSTed media type is "application/atom+xml" but the body is something other than an Atom Entry. In particular, what happens on POSTing an Atom Feed Document to a Collection using the "application/ atom+xml" media type is undefined. The Atom Protocol does not specify a means to create multiple representations of the same Resource (for example, a PNG and a JPG of the same image) either on creation or editing.
trans-unit.target: 客户可以将媒体资源以及条目资源发布到集合中。如果服务器接受了这样的请求，则它必须创建两个新的资源-一个与请求中发送的实体相对应的媒体资源，以及一个与之关联的成员条目媒体链接条目。 Media Link条目表示为Atom条目，并显示在“集合”中。媒体链接条目包含（可能是非文本的）媒体资源的元数据和IRI。因此，媒体链接条目使有关媒体资源的元数据可分别用于检索和更改。服务器可以使用第8.3.4 节中指定的服务文档中的app：accept元素来表示将接受的媒体类型。。对创建请求的成功响应必须在位置头中包含媒体链接条目的URI。媒体链接条目应该包含一个atom：link元素，该元素的链接关系为“ edit-media”，其中包含媒体资源IRI。媒体链接条目必须具有带有“ src”属性的atom：content元素。 “ src”属性的值是新创建的媒体资源的IRI。可选的是，atom：content元素上“ src”属性的IRI与媒体资源IRI相同。例如，“ src”属性值可能是指向静态缓存或内容分发网络的链接，而不是媒体资源IRI。要求实施者注意[ RFC4287]指定Atom条目必须包含atom：summary元素。因此，在成功创建媒体链接条目后，服务器可以选择使用从该元素派生的内容填充atom：summary元素（以及其他任何必需元素，例如atom：id，atom：author和atom：title）。 POST实体或任何其他来源。服务器可能不允许客户端修改这些元素的服务器选定值。对于资源创建，此规范仅定义POST主体具有声明为Atom媒体类型（“ application / atom + xml”）的Atom Entry实体或声明为非Atom媒体类型的非Atom实体的情况。当客户端将Atom条目发布到集合时，它可以使用“ application / atom + xml”或“ application / atom + xml”的媒体类型；如果POSTed媒体类型为“ application / atom + xml”，但主体不是Atom条目，则本规范未指定任何请求语义或服务器行为。特别是，在POST时会发生什么未定义使用“ application / atom + xml”媒体类型的Atom提要文档到集合。Atom协议未指定创建同一资源的多个表示形式的方法（例如，同一图像的PNG和JPG ）创建或编辑。未定义使用“ application / atom + xml”媒体类型将Atom Feed文档发布到集合时发生的情况。 Atom协议未指定在创建或编辑时创建同一资源的多个表示形式（例如，同一图像的PNG和JPG）的方法。未定义使用“ application / atom + xml”媒体类型将Atom Feed文档发布到集合时发生的情况。 Atom协议未指定在创建或编辑时创建同一资源的多个表示形式（例如，同一图像的PNG和JPG）的方法。

trans-unit.source: A client can express the desired push policy for a request by sending an Accept-Push-Policy header field in the request.
trans-unit.target: 客户端可以通过在请求中发送 Accept-Push-Policy 标头字段来表达请求的期望推送策略。

trans-unit.source: A client can send the Accept-Signature header field to indicate intention to take advantage of any available signatures and to indicate what kinds of signatures it supports.
trans-unit.target: 客户端可以发送“ Accept-Signature 标头字段以指示打算利用任何可用签名并指示其支持的签名类型。

trans-unit.source:
A client ought to limit the number of simultaneous open connections that it maintains to a given server.
Previous revisions of HTTP gave a specific number of connections as a ceiling, but this was found to be impractical for many applications. As a result, this specification does not mandate a particular maximum number of connections but, instead, encourages clients to be conservative when opening multiple connections.
Multiple connections are typically used to avoid the "head-of-line blocking" problem, wherein a request that takes significant server-side processing and/or has a large payload blocks subsequent requests on the same connection. However, each connection consumes server resources. Furthermore, using multiple connections can cause undesirable side effects in congested networks.
Note that a server might reject traffic that it deems abusive or characteristic of a denial-of-service attack, such as an excessive number of open connections from a single client.
trans-unit.target: 客户端应该限制它与某个服务器同时打开的连接数。以前的HTTP修订版给出了一个特定的连接数作为上限,但这对许多应用来说是不切实际的,因此,本规范并没有规定特定的最大连接数,而是鼓励客户端在打开多个连接时保持保守。因此,本规范并没有强制规定特定的最大连接数,而是鼓励客户端在打开多个连接时要保守。多重连接通常用于避免 "线头阻塞 "问题,即一个需要大量服务器端处理和/或有大量有效负载的请求会阻塞同一连接上的后续请求。然而,每个连接都会消耗服务器资源。此外,在拥挤的网络中,使用多个连接可能会引起不良的副作用。需要注意的是,服务器可能会拒绝它认为是滥用或具有拒绝服务攻击特征的流量,例如来自单个客户端的开放连接数量过多。

trans-unit.source: A client requests signals to the server that it supports the upgrade mechanisms of upgrade-insecure-requests:
trans-unit.target: 客户端向服务器请求信号，表明它支持 upgrade-insecure-requests 的升级机制：

trans-unit.source: A client sends a request with a Expect header and waits for the server to respond before sending the message body.
trans-unit.target: 客户端发送一个带有Expect头的请求,等待服务器响应后再发送消息主体。

trans-unit.source: A client sends request header fields to provide more information about the request context, make the request conditional based on the target resource state, suggest preferred formats for the response, supply authentication credentials, or modify the expected request processing. These fields act as request modifiers, similar to the parameters on a programming language method invocation.
trans-unit.target: 客户端发送请求头字段是为了提供更多关于请求上下文的信息,根据目标资源状态使请求成为条件,建议响应的首选格式,提供认证凭证,或修改预期的请求处理。这些字段作为请求修饰符,类似于编程语言方法调用的参数。

trans-unit.source: A client that supports persistent connections MAY "pipeline" its requests (i.e., send multiple requests without waiting for each response). A server MAY process a sequence of pipelined requests in parallel if they all have safe methods (Section 4.2.1 of [RFC7231]), but it MUST send the corresponding responses in the same order that the requests were received. A client that pipelines requests SHOULD retry unanswered requests if the connection closes before it receives all of the corresponding responses. When retrying pipelined requests after a failed connection (a connection not explicitly closed by the server in its last complete response), a client MUST NOT pipeline immediately after connection establishment, since the first remaining request in the prior pipeline might have caused an error response that can be lost again if multiple requests are sent on a prematurely closed connection (see the TCP reset problem described in Section 6.6). Idempotent methods (Section 4.2.2 of [RFC7231]) are significant to pipelining because they can be automatically retried after a connection failure. A user agent SHOULD NOT pipeline requests after a non-idempotent method, until the final response status code for that method has been received, unless the user agent has a means to detect and recover from partial failure conditions involving the pipelined sequence. An intermediary that receives pipelined requests MAY pipeline those requests when forwarding them inbound, since it can rely on the outbound user agent(s) to determine what requests can be safely pipelined. If the inbound connection fails before receiving a response, the pipelining intermediary MAY attempt to retry a sequence of requests that have yet to receive a response if the requests all have idempotent methods; otherwise, the pipelining intermediary SHOULD forward any received responses and then close the corresponding outbound connection(s) so that the outbound user agent(s) can recover accordingly.
trans-unit.target: 支持持久连接的客户端可以“流水线化”其请求（即，发送多个请求而不必等待每个响应）。如果服务器都具有安全方法，则服务器可以并行处理一系列管道请求（[RFC7231]第4.2.1节）），但它必须以收到请求的相同顺序发送相应的响应。如果流水线请求的客户端在收到所有相应的响应之前关闭，则该请求的管道应重试未答复的请求。当连接失败（服务器未在其最后一个完整响应中明确关闭的连接）后重试流水线请求时，客户端不得在建立连接后立即流水线，因为先前流水线中的第一个剩余请求可能会导致错误响应，如果在过早关闭的连接上发送了多个请求，则可能再次丢失（请参阅第6.6节中描述的TCP重置问题）。等幂方法（[RFC7231]第4.2.2节）对于管道传输很重要，因为在连接失败后可以自动重试它们。用户代理不应在非幂等方法之后进行管道请求，直到收到该方法的最终响应状态代码为止，除非用户代理具有检测并从涉及管道序列的部分故障情况中恢复的方法。接收流水线请求的中介可以在转发入站请求时流水线处理这些请求，因为它可以依靠出站用户代理确定可以安全地流水线处理哪些请求。如果入站连接在接收到响应之前失败，则流水线中介可以尝试重试尚未接收到响应的一系列请求，如果这些请求都具有幂等方法；除此以外，流水线中介应该转发任何收到的响应，然后关闭相应的出站连接，以便出站用户代理可以相应地恢复。

trans-unit.source: A client that supports persistent connections MAY "pipeline" its requests (i.e., send multiple requests without waiting for each response). A server MUST send its responses to those requests in the same order that the requests were received. Clients which assume persistent connections and pipeline immediately after connection establishment SHOULD be prepared to retry their connection if the first pipelined attempt fails. If a client does such a retry, it MUST NOT pipeline before it knows the connection is persistent. Clients MUST also be prepared to resend their requests if the server closes the connection before sending all of the corresponding responses. Clients SHOULD NOT pipeline requests using non-idempotent methods or non-idempotent sequences of methods (see section 9.1.2). Otherwise, a premature termination of the transport connection could lead to indeterminate results. A client wishing to send a non-idempotent request SHOULD wait to send that request until it has received the response status for the previous request.
trans-unit.target: 支持持久连接的客户端可以“流水线化”其请求（即，发送多个请求而不必等待每个响应）。服务器必须按照收到请求的顺序发送对这些请求的响应。如果第一次流水线尝试失败，则在建立连接后立即假定持久连接和流水线的客户端应准备重试其连接。如果客户端进行了这样的重试，则它在知道连接是持久的之前绝不能进行管道传输。如果服务器在发送所有相应的响应之前关闭了连接，则客户端还必须准备重新发送其请求。客户端不应该使用非等幂方法或非等幂方法序列来管道请求（请参阅第9.1.2节））。否则，传输连接的过早终止可能导致不确定的结果。希望发送非幂等请求的客户端应该等待发送该请求，直到它收到前一个请求的响应状态为止。

trans-unit.source: A client that wants to authenticate itself with the server can then do so by including an Authorization request header with the credentials.
A client to display (and accidentally edit) these documents, the first Web browser called WorldWideWeb.
trans-unit.target: 一个客户端来显示（并意外地编​​辑）这些文档，第一个Web浏览器称为WorldWideWeb。

trans-unit.source: A client's request signals to the server that it supports the upgrade mechanisms of upgrade-insecure-requests:
A collection of tips to help operational teams with creating secure web applications.
trans-unit.target: 帮助运营团队创建安全网络应用的技巧集锦。

trans-unit.source: A comma-delimited list of HTTP headers that are included in the request.
trans-unit.target: 请求中包含的HTTP标头的逗号分隔列表。

trans-unit.source: A comma-delineated list of the WebSocket protocol versions supported by the server.
trans-unit.target: 服务器支持的 WebSocket 协议版本的逗号分隔列表。

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of extensions to request (or agree to support). These should be selected from the IANA WebSocket Extension Name Registry. Extensions which take parameters do so by using semicolon delineation.
trans-unit.target: 以逗号分隔的扩展列表，以请求（或同意支持）扩展。这些应该从IANA WebSocket扩展名称注册表中选择。带有参数的扩展通过使用分号定界来实现。

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of header names to take into account when deciding whether or not a cached response can be used.
trans-unit.target: 在决定是否可以使用缓存响应时,要考虑到以逗号分隔的头名列表。

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of parameters, each consisting of an identifier and a value separated by the equal sign ('='). The following identifiers are possible:
trans-unit.target: 以逗号分隔的参数列表，每个参数由一个标识符和一个由等号（ '=' ）分隔的值组成。以下标识符是可能的：

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of subprotocol names, in the order of preference. The subprotocols may be selected from the IANA WebSocket Subprotocol Name Registry or may be a custom name jointly understood by the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: 子协议名称的逗号分隔列表，按优先顺序排列。子协议可以从IANA WebSocket子协议名称注册表中选择，也可以是客户端和服务器共同理解的自定义名称。

trans-unit.source: A common case is when a site resides at www.example.com, but accessing it from example.com should also work. Redirections for example.com to www.example.com are thus set up. You might also redirect from common synonyms or frequent typos of your domains.

A common operation in Web applications is to update a remote document. This is very common in any file system or source control applications, but any application that allows to store remote resources needs such a mechanism. Common Web sites, like wikis and other CMS, have such a need.
trans-unit.target: Web应用程序中的常见操作是更新远程文档。这在任何文件系统或源代码控制应用程序中都很常见，但是任何允许存储远程资源的应用程序都需要这种机制。诸如Wiki和其他CMS之类的通用Web站点有此需求。

trans-unit.source: A complete URL, known as the absolute form, is mostly used with GET when connected to a proxy.
trans-unit.target: 连接到代理时，完整的URL（称为绝对格式）通常与 GET 一起使用。

trans-unit.source: A compression format using the Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77), with a 32-bit CRC.
trans-unit.target: 使用Lempel-Ziv编码（LZ77）和32位CRC的压缩格式。

trans-unit.source: A compression format using the Lempel-Ziv-Welch (LZW) algorithm.
A compression format using the zlib structure, with the deflate compression algorithm.
trans-unit.target: 使用zlib结构和deflate压缩算法的压缩格式。

trans-unit.source: A compression format using the Brotli algorithm.
A compression format using the Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77), with a 32-bit CRC.
A compression format using the Lempel-Ziv-Welch (LZW) algorithm.
A compression format using the zlib structure, with the deflate compression algorithm.
A connection can be reused, saving the time to reopen it numerous times to display the resources embedded into the single original document retrieved.
trans-unit.target: 一个连接可以重复使用,节省了多次重新打开连接的时间,以显示嵌入到单个原始文档检索的资源。

trans-unit.source: A connection is controlled at the transport layer, and therefore fundamentally out of scope for HTTP. Though HTTP doesn't require the underlying transport protocol to be connection-based; only requiring it to be reliable, or not lose messages (so at minimum presenting an error). Among the two most common transport protocols on the Internet, TCP is reliable and UDP isn't. HTTP subsequently relies on the TCP standard, which is connection-based, even though a connection is not always required.
trans-unit.target: 连接是在传输层进行控制的，因此基本上不在HTTP的范围之内。尽管HTTP不需要底层的传输协议是基于连接的；仅要求它可靠，否则不会丢失消息（因此至少会出现错误）。在Internet上最常见的两种传输协议中，TCP是可靠的，而UDP不是。HTTP随后依赖于基于连接的TCP标准，即使并不总是需要连接也是如此。

trans-unit.source: A connection is controlled at the transport layer, and therefore fundamentally out of scope for HTTP. Though HTTP doesn't require the underlying transport protocol to be connection-based; only requiring it to be reliable, or not lose messages (so at minimum presenting an error). Among the two most common transport protocols on the Internet, TCP is reliable and UDP isn't. HTTP therefore relies on the TCP standard, which is connection-based.
A cookie begins with a name-value pair:
trans-unit.target: 一个cookie的开头有一个名值对。

trans-unit.source: A cookie belonging to a domain that does not include the origin server should be rejected by the user agent. The following cookie will be rejected if it was set by a server hosted on originalcompany.com.
trans-unit.target: 用户代理应拒绝属于不包含原始服务器的域的cookie 。如果以下cookie是由originalcompany.com上托管的服务器设置的，则将被拒绝。

trans-unit.source: A cookie for a domain that does not include the server that set it should be rejected by the user agent.
A cookie for a sub domain of the serving domain will be rejected.

A cookie is associated with a domain. If this domain is the same as the domain of the page you are on, the cookie is called a first-party cookie. If the domain is different, it is a third-party cookie. While the server hosting a web page sets first-party cookies, the page may contain images or other components stored on servers in other domains (for example, ad banners), which may set third-party cookies. These are mainly used for advertising and tracking across the web. See for example the types of cookies used by Google. A third party server can build up a profile of a user's browsing history and habits based on cookies sent to it by the same browser when accessing multiple sites. Firefox, by default, blocks third-party cookies that are known to contain trackers. Third-party cookies (or just tracking cookies) may also be blocked by other browser settings or extensions. Cookie blocking can cause some third-party components (such as social media widgets) to not function as intended.

A cookie with the HttpOnly attribute is inaccessible to the JavaScript Document.cookie API; it is sent only to the server. For example, cookies that persist server-side sessions don't need to be available to JavaScript, and should have the HttpOnly attribute. This precaution helps mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

A cookie with the Secure attribute is sent to the server only with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol, never with unsecured HTTP (except on localhost), and therefore can't easily be accessed by a man-in-the-middle attacker. Insecure sites (with http: in the URL) can't set cookies with the Secure attribute. However, do not assume that Secure prevents all access to sensitive information in cookies; for example, it can be read and modified by someone with access to the client's hard disk (or JavaScript if the HttpOnly attribute is not set).

A correct cache MUST respond to a request with the most up-to-date response held by the cache that is appropriate to the request (see sections 13.2.5, 13.2.6, and 13.12) which meets one of the following conditions: 1. It has been checked for equivalence with what the origin server would have returned by revalidating the response with the origin server (section 13.3); 2. It is "fresh enough" (see section 13.2). In the default case, this means it meets the least restrictive freshness requirement of the client, origin server, and cache (see section 14.9); if the origin server so specifies, it is the freshness requirement of the origin server alone. If a stored response is not "fresh enough" by the most restrictive freshness requirement of both the client and the origin server, in carefully considered circumstances the cache MAY still return the response with the appropriate Warning header (see section 13.1.5 and 14.46), unless such a response is prohibited (e.g., by a "no-store" cache-directive, or by a "no-cache" cache-request-directive; see section 14.9). 3. It is an appropriate 304 (Not Modified), 305 (Proxy Redirect), or error (4xx or 5xx) response message. If the cache can not communicate with the origin server, then a correct cache SHOULD respond as above if the response can be correctly served from the cache; if not it MUST return an error or warning indicating that there was a communication failure. If a cache receives a response (either an entire response, or a 304 (Not Modified) response) that it would normally forward to the requesting client, and the received response is no longer fresh, the cache SHOULD forward it to the requesting client without adding a new Warning (but without removing any existing Warning headers). A cache SHOULD NOT attempt to revalidate a response simply because that response became stale in transit; this might lead to an infinite loop. A user agent that receives a stale response without a Warning MAY display a warning indication to the user.
trans-unit.target: 与由为适合于该请求的缓存中保存的最先进的最新响应的请求的正确缓存必须响应（见章节13.2.5，13.2.6，和13.12），其满足下列条件之一：1通过与原始服务器重新验证响应，检查了与原始服务器将返回的内容是否相等（第13.3节）； 2.它“足够新鲜”（请参阅第13.2节）。在默认情况下，这意味着它满足了客户端，原始服务器和缓存的最低限度的新鲜度要求（请参阅第14.9节）。）;如果原始服务器如此指定，则仅是原始服务器的新鲜度要求。如果存储的响应由于客户端和原始服务器的最严格的新鲜度要求而“不够新鲜”，则在经过仔细考虑的情况下，高速缓存仍可以返回带有适当警告标头的响应（参见13.1.5和14.46 节）。 ，除非这样的响应被禁止（例如，通过“无存储”缓存指令或“无缓存”缓存请求指令；请参阅第14.9节））。 3.它是适当的304（未修改），305（代理重定向）或错误（4xx或5xx）响应消息。如果缓存不能与原始服务器通信，那么如果可以从缓存中正确地响应，则正确的缓存应该如上所述响应。如果不是，则必须返回错误或警告，表明存在通信故障。如果缓存收到了通常会转发给请求客户端的响应（整个响应或304（未修改）响应），并且接收到的响应不再新鲜，则缓存应将其转发给请求客户端，而无需添加新的警告（但不删除任何现有的警告标头）。缓存不应仅仅因为该响应在传输过程中变得陈旧，就不应尝试重新验证该响应。这可能会导致无限循环。收到过时的响应但没有警告的用户代理可以向用户显示警告指示。

trans-unit.source: A cross-site request has previously been performed that already did a preflight, and doing the preflight again is not permitted. Make sure your code only preflights once per connection.
trans-unit.target: 之前已经执行了一个跨站请求,已经做了一次预飞,再次做预飞是不允许的。确保你的代码每个连接只预飞一次。

trans-unit.source: A custom header (such as X-PINGARUNER) is sent with the request.
trans-unit.target: 自定义标头（例如 X-PINGARUNER ）与请求一起发送。

trans-unit.source: A date after which to retry. See the Date header for more details on the HTTP date format.
trans-unit.target: 重试的日期。有关HTTP日期格式的更多详细信息，请参见 Date 标头。

trans-unit.source: A description of the protected area, the realm. If no realm is specified, clients often display a formatted host name instead.

trans-unit.source: A format using the Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77), with a 32-bit CRC is accepted as a transfer coding name.

trans-unit.source: A format using the Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77), with a 32-bit CRC. This is originally the format of the UNIX gzip program. The HTTP/1.1 standard also recommends that the servers supporting this content-encoding should recognize x-gzip as an alias, for compatibility purposes.
trans-unit.target: 使用Lempel-Ziv编码（LZ77）和32位CRC 的格式。这最初是UNIX gzip程序的格式。HTTP / 1.1标准还建议出于兼容性目的，支持此内容编码的服务器应将 x-gzip 识别为别名。

trans-unit.source: A format using the Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77), with a 32-bit CRC. This is the original format of the UNIX gzip program. The HTTP/1.1 standard also recommends that the servers supporting this content-encoding should recognize x-gzip as an alias, for compatibility purposes.
trans-unit.target: 使用Lempel-Ziv编码（LZ77）和32位CRC 的格式。这是UNIX gzip程序的原始格式。HTTP / 1.1标准还建议出于兼容性目的，支持此内容编码的服务器应将 x-gzip 识别为别名。

trans-unit.target: 接受使用Lempel-Ziv-Welch（LZW）算法的格式作为传输编码名称。

trans-unit.source: A format using the Lempel-Ziv-Welch (LZW) algorithm. The value name was taken from the UNIX compress program, which implemented this algorithm.
trans-unit.target: 使用Lempel-Ziv-Welch（LZW）算法的格式。值名称取自UNIX 压缩程序，该程序实现了该算法。

trans-unit.source: A format using the Lempel-Ziv-Welch (LZW) algorithm. The value name was taken from the UNIX compress program, which implemented this algorithm. Like the compress program, which has disappeared from most UNIX distributions, this content-encoding is not used by many browsers today, partly because of a patent issue (it expired in 2003).
trans-unit.target: 使用Lempel-Ziv-Welch（LZW）算法的格式。值名称取自UNIX 压缩程序，该程序实现了该算法。像compress程序（已从大多数UNIX发行版中消失了）一样，这种内容编码在当今的许多浏览器中并未使用，部分原因是专利问题（该专利于2003年到期）。

trans-unit.source: A forward proxy, or gateway, or just "proxy" provides proxy services to a client or a group of clients. There are likely hundreds of thousands of open forward proxies on the Internet. They store and forward Internet services (like the DNS, or web pages) to reduce and control the bandwidth used by the group.
trans-unit.target: 前向代理,或网关,或只是 "代理",为一个客户或一组客户提供代理服务。互联网上可能有成千上万个开放的转发代理。它们存储和转发互联网服务(如DNS,或网页),以减少和控制该组使用的带宽。

trans-unit.source: A fresh response is one whose age has not yet exceeded its freshness lifetime. Conversely, a stale response is one where it has. A response's freshness lifetime is the length of time between its generation by the origin server and its expiration time. An explicit expiration time is the time at which the origin server intends that a stored response can no longer be used by a cache without further validation, whereas a heuristic expiration time is assigned by a cache when no explicit expiration time is available. A response's age is the time that has passed since it was generated by, or successfully validated with, the origin server. When a response is "fresh" in the cache, it can be used to satisfy subsequent requests without contacting the origin server, thereby improving efficiency. The primary mechanism for determining freshness is for an origin server to provide an explicit expiration time in the future, using either the Expires header field (Section 5.3) or the max-age response directive (Section 5.2.2.8). Generally, origin servers will assign future explicit expiration times to responses in the belief that the representation is not likely to change in a semantically significant way before the expiration time is reached. If an origin server wishes to force a cache to validate every request, it can assign an explicit expiration time in the past to indicate that the response is already stale. Compliant caches will normally validate a stale cached response before reusing it for subsequent requests (see Section 4.2.4). Since origin servers do not always provide explicit expiration times, caches are also allowed to use a heuristic to determine an expiration time under certain circumstances (see Section 4.2.2). The calculation to determine if a response is fresh is: response_is_fresh = (freshness_lifetime > current_age) freshness_lifetime is defined in Section 4.2.1; current_age is defined in Section 4.2.3. Clients can send the max-age or min-fresh cache directives in a request to constrain or relax freshness calculations for the corresponding response (Section 5.2.1). When calculating freshness, to avoid common problems in date parsing: o Although all date formats are specified to be case-sensitive, a cache recipient SHOULD match day, week, and time-zone names case-insensitively. o If a cache recipient's internal implementation of time has less resolution than the value of an HTTP-date, the recipient MUST internally represent a parsed Expires date as the nearest time equal to or earlier than the received value. o A cache recipient MUST NOT allow local time zones to influence the calculation or comparison of an age or expiration time. o A cache recipient SHOULD consider a date with a zone abbreviation other than GMT or UTC to be invalid for calculating expiration. Note that freshness applies only to cache operation; it cannot be used to force a user agent to refresh its display or reload a resource. See Section 6 for an explanation of the difference between caches and history mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: 新鲜的反应是其年龄尚未超过其新鲜寿命的反应。相反，陈旧的响应就是它所具有的响应。响应的新鲜度生存期是由原始服务器生成响应到终止时间之间的时间长度。显式到期时间是指原始服务器打算在没有进一步验证的情况下不再由缓存使用存储的响应的时间，而当没有显式到期时间可用时，缓存将分配启发式到期时间。响应的期限是指源服务器生成或成功验证该响应以来所经过的时间。当响应在高速缓存中是“新鲜的”时，可以将其用于满足后续请求而无需联系原始服务器，从而提高了效率。确定新鲜度的主要机制是使原始服务器将来使用Expires标头字段（5.3节）或max-age response指令（5.2.2.8节）。通常，在认为表示形式在达到到期时间之前不太可能以语义上重要的方式发生变化的情况下，原始服务器会将未来的明确到期时间分配给响应。如果源服务器希望强制缓存验证每个请求，则它可以分配过去的显式到期时间以指示响应已过时。兼容的缓存通常会先验证过时的缓存响应，然后再将其用于后续请求（请参阅第4.2.4节））。由于原始服务器并不总是提供明确的到期时间，因此在某些情况下，也允许缓存使用启发式方法来确定到期时间（请参阅第4.2.2节）。确定响应是否新鲜的计算为：response_is_fresh =（freshness_lifetime> current_age）新鲜度_lifetime在第4.2.1节中定义； current_age在4.2.3节中定义。客户可以在请求中发送max-age或min-fresh缓存指令，以约束或放松相应响应的新鲜度计算（第5.2.1节））。在计算新鲜度时，为了避免日期解析中的常见问题：o尽管所有日期格式都被指定为区分大小写，但是缓存接收者应不区分大小写地匹配日期，星期和时区名称。 o如果缓存接收者的内部时间实现的分辨率小于HTTP日期的值，则接收者必须在内部将解析后的Expires日期表示为等于或早于接收值的最近时间。 o缓存接收者必须不允许本地时区影响时间或到期时间的计算或比较。 o缓存接收者应该认为带区域缩写（GMT或UTC除外）的日期对于计算到期时间无效。请注意，新鲜度仅适用于缓存操作；它不能用于强制用户代理刷新其显示或重新加载资源。看到第6节解释了缓存和历史记录机制之间的区别。

trans-unit.source: A full language tag. In addition to the language itself, it may contain additional information after a '-'. The most common extra information is the country variant (like 'en-US') or the type of alphabet to use (like 'sr-Lat'). Other variants like the type of orthography ('de-DE-1996') are usually not used in the context of this header.
trans-unit.target: 完整的语言标签。除了语言本身之外，它还可以在 '-' 之后包含其他信息。最常见的附加信息是国家/地区变体（例如 'en-US' ）或要使用的字母类型（例如 'sr-Lat' ）。拼字法类型（ 'de-DE-1996' ）之类的其他变体通常不在此标头的上下文中使用。

trans-unit.source: A general warning field containing information about possible problems.
trans-unit.target: 载有可能出现的问题信息的一般警告字段;

trans-unit.source: A language expressed as a 2 or 3-character string.
trans-unit.target: 以2个或3个字符的字符串表示的语言。

trans-unit.source: A language tag (which is sometimes referred to as a "locale identifier"). This consists of a 2-3 letter base language tag representing the language, optionally followed by additional subtags separated by '-'. The most common extra information is the country or region variant (like 'en-US' or 'fr-CA') or the type of alphabet to use (like 'sr-Latn'). Other variants like the type of orthography ('de-DE-1996') are usually not used in the context of this header.

A language tag identifies a natural language spoken, written, or otherwise conveyed by human beings for communication of information to other human beings. Computer languages are explicitly excluded. HTTP uses language tags within the Accept-Language and Content- Language fields. The syntax and registry of HTTP language tags is the same as that defined by RFC 1766 [1]. In summary, a language tag is composed of 1 or more parts: A primary language tag and a possibly empty series of subtags: language-tag = primary-tag *( "-" subtag ) primary-tag = 1*8ALPHA subtag = 1*8ALPHA White space is not allowed within the tag and all tags are case- insensitive. The name space of language tags is administered by the IANA. Example tags include: en, en-US, en-cockney, i-cherokee, x-pig-latin where any two-letter primary-tag is an ISO-639 language abbreviation and any two-letter initial subtag is an ISO-3166 country code. (The last three tags above are not registered tags; all but the last are examples of tags which could be registered in future.)
trans-unit.target: 语言标签标识人类说，写或以其他方式传达的用于将信息传达给其他人类的自然语言。明确排除了计算机语言。 HTTP在“接受语言”和“内容语言”字段中使用语言标签。 HTTP语言标签的语法和注册表与RFC 1766 [ 1]。总之，语言标签由1个或多个部分组成：主要语言标签和可能为空的一系列子标签：language-tag = primary-tag *（“-” subtag）primary-tag = 1 * 8ALPHA subtag = 1 * 8ALPHA标签内不允许有空格，并且所有标签都不区分大小写。语言标签的名称空间由IANA管理。示例标签包括：en，en-US，en-cockney，i-cherokee，x-pig-latin，其中任何两个字母的主要标签是ISO-639语言的缩写，并且任何两个字母的初始子标签是ISO-3166国家代码。 （上面的最后三个标签不是已注册的标签；除最后三个标签外，其余均为将来可以注册的标签的示例。）

trans-unit.source: A language tag, as defined in [RFC5646], identifies a natural language spoken, written, or otherwise conveyed by human beings for communication of information to other human beings. Computer languages are explicitly excluded. HTTP uses language tags within the Accept-Language and Content-Language header fields. Accept-Language uses the broader language-range production defined in Section 5.3.5, whereas Content-Language uses the language-tag production defined below. language-tag = <Language-Tag, see [RFC5646], Section 2.1> A language tag is a sequence of one or more case-insensitive subtags, each separated by a hyphen character ("-", %x2D). In most cases, a language tag consists of a primary language subtag that identifies a broad family of related languages (e.g., "en" = English), which is optionally followed by a series of subtags that refine or narrow that language's range (e.g., "en-CA" = the variety of English as communicated in Canada). Whitespace is not allowed within a language tag. Example tags include: fr, en-US, es-419, az-Arab, x-pig-latin, man-Nkoo-GN See [RFC5646] for further information.
trans-unit.target: [ RFC5646 ]中定义的语言标签标识人类说，写或以其他方式传达的自然语言，用于将信息传达给其他人类。明确排除了计算机语言。 HTTP在Accept-Language和Content-Language标头字段中使用语言标签。 Accept-Language使用第5.3.5节中定义的更广泛的语言范围产生，而Content-Language使用下面定义的语言标签产生。 language-tag = <Language-Tag，请参阅[RFC5646]，第2.1节>语言标签是一个或多个不区分大小写的子标签的序列，每个子标签由连字符（“-”，％x2D）分隔。在大多数情况下，语言标签由主要的语言子标签组成，该子标签标识了广泛的相关语言系列（例如，“ en” =英语），其后可以是一系列子标签，这些子标签可以细化或缩小该语言的范围（例如， “ en-CA” =加拿大交流的英语种类）。语言标记内不允许使用空格。示例标签包括：fr，en-US，es-419，az-Arab，x-pig-latin，man-Nkoo-GN。有关更多信息，请参见[ RFC5646 ]。

trans-unit.source: A list of exposed headers consisting of zero or more header names other than the CORS-safelisted request headers that the resource might use and can be exposed.
A list of exposed headers consisting of zero or more header names other than the simple response headers that the resource might use and can be exposed.
trans-unit.target: 由零个或多个标头名称组成的公开标头列表，而不是资源可能使用并且可以公开的简单响应标头。

trans-unit.source: A list of name-value pairs in the form of <cookie-name>=<cookie-value>. Pairs in the list are separated by a semicolon and a space ('; ').
trans-unit.target: 以 <cookie-name>=<cookie-value> 形式的名称/值对列表。列表中的对以分号和空格（ '; ' ）分隔。

trans-unit.source: A lock MAY have a limited lifetime. The lifetime is suggested by the client when creating or refreshing the lock, but the server ultimately chooses the timeout value. Timeout is measured in seconds remaining until lock expiration. The timeout counter MUST be restarted if a refresh lock request is successful (see Section 9.10.2). The timeout counter SHOULD NOT be restarted at any other time. If the timeout expires, then the lock SHOULD be removed. In this case the server SHOULD act as if an UNLOCK method was executed by the server on the resource using the lock token of the timed-out lock, performed with its override authority. Servers are advised to pay close attention to the values submitted by clients, as they will be indicative of the type of activity the client intends to perform. For example, an applet running in a browser may need to lock a resource, but because of the instability of the environment within which the applet is running, the applet may be turned off without warning. As a result, the applet is likely to ask for a relatively small timeout value so that if the applet dies, the lock can be quickly harvested. However, a document management system is likely to ask for an extremely long timeout because its user may be planning on going offline. A client MUST NOT assume that just because the timeout has expired, the lock has immediately been removed. Likewise, a client MUST NOT assume that just because the timeout has not expired, the lock still exists. Clients MUST assume that locks can arbitrarily disappear at any time, regardless of the value given in the Timeout header. The Timeout header only indicates the behavior of the server if extraordinary circumstances do not occur. For example, a sufficiently privileged user may remove a lock at any time, or the system may crash in such a way that it loses the record of the lock's existence.
trans-unit.target: 锁的寿命可能有限。客户端在创建或刷新锁时会建议生存期，但是服务器最终会选择超时值。超时以秒为单位度量，直到锁到期。如果刷新锁定请求成功，则必须重新启动超时计数器（请参见第9.10.2节））。超时计数器不应在任何其他时间重新启动。如果超时到期，则应删除锁。在这种情况下，服务器应该表现为服务器使用超时锁定的锁定令牌对资源执行了UNLOCK方法，该方法以其覆盖权限执行。建议服务器密切注意客户端提交的值，因为它们将指示客户端打算执行的活动类型。例如，在浏览器中运行的小程序可能需要锁定资源，但是由于运行小程序的环境的不稳定，可能会在没有警告的情况下关闭小程序。结果，该小程序可能会要求一个相对较小的超时值，以便如果该小程序死了，则可以快速获取该锁。但是，文档管理系统可能会要求非常长的超时时间，因为其用户可能正在计划离线。客户端不得认为仅由于超时时间已过而立即删除了该锁。同样，客户端不得仅因为超时未到期就认为锁仍然存在。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中提供了什么值，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。文档管理系统可能会要求非常长的超时，因为其用户可能正在计划离线。客户端不得认为仅由于超时已过期就立即删除了该锁。同样，客户端不得仅因为超时未到期就认为锁仍然存在。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中提供了什么值，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。文档管理系统可能会要求非常长的超时时间，因为其用户可能正在计划离线。客户端不得认为仅由于超时已过期就立即删除了该锁。同样，客户端不得仅因为超时未到期就认为锁仍然存在。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中提供了什么值，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。客户端不得认为仅由于超时已过期就立即删除了该锁。同样，客户端不得仅因为超时未到期就认为锁仍然存在。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中提供了什么值，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。客户端不得认为仅由于超时已过期就立即删除了该锁。同样，客户端不得仅因为超时未到期就认为锁仍然存在。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中给出的值如何，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中给出的值如何，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。客户端必须假定，无论Timeout标头中提供了什么值，锁都可以在任何时间任意消失。如果没有发生异常情况，则Timeout标头仅指示服务器的行为。例如，具有足够特权的用户可以随时删除锁，或者系统可能以丢失锁存在记录的方式崩溃。

trans-unit.source:
A lock is refreshed by sending a LOCK request to the URL of a resource within the scope of the lock. This request MUST NOT have a body and it MUST specify which lock to refresh by using the 'If' header with a single lock token (only one lock may be refreshed at a time). The request MAY contain a Timeout header, which a server MAY accept to change the duration remaining on the lock to the new value. A server MUST ignore the Depth header on a LOCK refresh.
If the resource has other (shared) locks, those locks are unaffected by a lock refresh. Additionally, those locks do not prevent the named lock from being refreshed.
The Lock-Token header is not returned in the response for a successful refresh LOCK request, but the LOCK response body MUST contain the new value for the DAV:lockdiscovery property.
trans-unit.target: 通过向锁的范围内的资源的URL发送LOCK请求来刷新锁。这个请求必须没有主体,而且必须通过使用'If'头和一个锁标记来指定要刷新的锁(一次只能刷新一个锁)。请求中可以包含一个超时头,服务器可以接受这个超时头来改变锁上剩余的持续时间到新的值。服务器必须忽略LOCK刷新时的Depth头。如果资源有其他(共享)锁,这些锁不受锁刷新的影响。此外,这些锁不会阻止命名的锁被刷新。在成功刷新LOCK请求的响应中不返回Lock-Token头,但LOCK响应体必须包含DAV:lockdiscovery属性的新值。

trans-unit.source: A lock token is a type of state token that identifies a particular lock. Each lock has exactly one unique lock token generated by the server. Clients MUST NOT attempt to interpret lock tokens in any way. Lock token URIs MUST be unique across all resources for all time. This uniqueness constraint allows lock tokens to be submitted across resources and servers without fear of confusion. Since lock tokens are unique, a client MAY submit a lock token in an If header on a resource other than the one that returned it. When a LOCK operation creates a new lock, the new lock token is returned in the Lock-Token response header defined in Section 10.5, and also in the body of the response. Servers MAY make lock tokens publicly readable (e.g., in the DAV: lockdiscovery property). One use case for making lock tokens readable is so that a long-lived lock can be removed by the resource owner (the client that obtained the lock might have crashed or disconnected before cleaning up the lock). Except for the case of using UNLOCK under user guidance, a client SHOULD NOT use a lock token created by another client instance. This specification encourages servers to create Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs) for lock tokens, and to use the URI form defined by "A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) URN Namespace" ([RFC4122]). However, servers are free to use any URI (e.g., from another scheme) so long as it meets the uniqueness requirements. For example, a valid lock token might be constructed using the "opaquelocktoken" scheme defined in Appendix C. Example: "urn:uuid:f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6"
trans-unit.target: 锁令牌是一种标识特定锁的状态令牌。每个锁都有服务器生成的唯一一个唯一的锁令牌。客户不得尝试以任何方式解释锁令牌。锁定令牌URI必须在所有时间内始终在所有资源中都是唯一的。这种唯一性约束使锁令牌可以跨资源和服务器提交，而不必担心混淆。由于锁令牌是唯一的，所以一个客户端可以在资源的If头中提交一个锁令牌，而不是返回它的资源。当LOCK操作创建新锁时，新的锁令牌将在第10.5节中定义的Lock-Token响应标头中返回，并且也在响应中显示。服务器可以使锁令牌公开可见（例如，在DAV：lockdiscovery属性中）。一种使锁令牌可读的用例是，资源所有者可以删除一个长期存在的锁（获得该锁的客户端在清除锁之前可能已崩溃或断开连接）。除了在用户指导下使用UNLOCK的情况外，客户端不应使用由另一个客户端实例创建的锁令牌。该规范鼓励服务器为锁令牌创建通用唯一标识符（UUID），并使用“通用唯一标识符（UUID）URN命名空间”（[ RFC4122]）。但是，服务器可以自由使用任何URI（例如，来自另一个方案），只要它满足唯一性要求即可。例如，可以使用附录C中定义的“ opaquelocktoken”方案来构造有效的锁定令牌。示例：“ urn：uuid：f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6”
一个可供机器使用的电子邮件地址。

trans-unit.source: A message that encapsulates other messages. This can be used, for instance, to represent an email that includes a forwarded message as part of its data, or to allow sending very large messages in chunks as if it were multiple messages. Examples include message/rfc822 (for forwarded or replied-to message quoting) and message/partial to allow breaking a large message into smaller ones automatically to be reassembled by the recipient.

A method other than GET or POST is used, or if POST is used with a Content-Typeother than one of application/x-www-form-urlencoded, multipart/form-data, or text/plain. For instance, if the Content-Type of the POST body is application/xml, a request is preflighted.
trans-unit.target: 以外的方法， GET 或 POST 被使用，或者如果 POST 与使用 Content-Type 以外的一个 application/x-www-form-urlencoded ， multipart/form-data ，或 text/plain 。例如，如果该 Content-Type 的的 POST 体是 application/xml ，一个请求被预检。

trans-unit.source: A more radical approach to cookies are zombie cookies or "Evercookies" which are recreated after their deletion and are intentionally hard to delete forever. They are using the Web storage API, Flash Local Shared Objects and other techniques to recreate themselves whenever the cookie's absence is detected.
trans-unit.target: 对于Cookie而言，更彻底的方法是僵尸Cookie或“ Evercookies”，它们在删除后会重新创建，并且有意永久删除。每当检测到cookie不存在时，他们就会使用Web存储API，Flash本地共享对象和其他技术来重新创建自己。

trans-unit.source: A non-negative decimal integer indicating the seconds to delay after the response is received.
trans-unit.target: 一个非负十进制整数,表示收到响应后的延迟秒数。

trans-unit.source: A non-negative integer, representing time in seconds the object has been in a proxy cache.
trans-unit.target: 一个非负数整数,表示对象在代理缓存中的时间,以秒为单位。

trans-unit.source: A number of security issues (e.g. phishing) have been associated with data URLs, and navigating to them in the browser's top level. To mitigate such issues, top-level navigation to data:// URIs has been blocked in Firefox 59+ (release version, Nightly/Beta from 58), and we hope to see other browsers follow suit soon. See Blocking Top-Level Navigations to data URLs for Firefox 58 for more details.
trans-unit.target: 数据URL关联了许多安全问题（例如网络钓鱼），并在浏览器的顶层导航到这些URL。为缓解此类问题，Firefox 59+（发行版，Nightly / Beta从58开始）已禁止对 data:// URI的顶级导航，我们希望很快其他浏览器也能效仿。有关更多详细信息，请参阅阻止对Firefox 58的数据URL的顶级导航。
